boardgame.name: The Great City of Parapette Part 1
boardgame.description:
From Patreon:

Welcome to the Great City of Parapette, the first 'fixed' location in Colostle. This means there is one instance of Parapette across all Colostle games. If you go there, and other players go there, you are going to the same place, and might meet!

There are a lot of rules in this module that make specific use of the Discord server for players who want to interact with other players. However, none of that is necessary if you don't want to do it, and you can enjoy everything as simply new prompts and locations for your character to discover in solo adventures too.

boardgame.name: A Sticky Situation
boardgame.description: The Third Adventure from the Dungeons & Dragons and NERDS promotion. Includes the Character Sheet for "Orange" as a fighter.

boardgame.name: Hellapagos
boardgame.description:
Hellapagos is a "co-opetition" game in which players struggle to survive on a desert island and build a raft to escape before a hurricane devastates them. While players need to work together, its not likely that everyone will survive this backstabbing negotiation game for up to twelve players.

This edition includes the expansion "They're No Longer Alone" that adds the following new features to the game: 20 character cards, 30 event cards and 20 additional Shipwreck cards.

All three expansion elements are independent; players can incorporate a single new component, or all three if they wish.

boardgame.name: The Absolutely Ordinary Cave
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The cave itself is wet and dark, cavernous and ominous.

And so you find yourself outside the Absolutely Ordinary Cave. You didn't bring weapons or equipment, just determination and spite.

This is how you'll prove yourself as a real adventurer.

Good Luck.

boardgame.name: Total Phagocytic Killer
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Total Phagocytic Killer (TPK) is a Powered by the Apocalypse game about the immune system. Player Cells (PCs) are tasked with finding pathogens and stopping them from wreaking havoc in the host! The Germ Master (GM) plays as the environment, including both friendly (and not so friendly) cells.

There are 5 different playbooks to choose from:

- B Lymphocytes

- T Lymphocytes

- Natural Killer Cells

- Macrophages

- Neutrophils

In addition to actions all cells can take, each type of immune cell possesses their own unique set of skills to get to the bottom of what is threatening the body you all call home

boardgame.name: Green Team Wins
boardgame.description:
Players will be on one of two teams: Orange Team or Green Team. And then the Green Team wins.

Everyone will be asked the same question, then writes down their responses at the same time. All players with the winning answer join the Green Team and score points.

But it's not about having the best answer, or the smartest answer, or the funniest answer. Only the most popular answer wins - the one that the most players at the table wrote down.

To win, get on the Green Team, stay on the Green Team, and win - because that's what the Green Team does. They win.

—description from the designer
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Green Team Wins
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Green Team Wins - Gaming Community Promo Pack

boardgame.name: Match It!: Picture Word Bingo
boardgame.description:
Be the first to fill your board with matching picture cards in this beginning reader game.

Shuffle the picture cards and set them in a pile. As they are revealed the player with the matching item claims it to place on their board. Continue until someone folks their board and yells, "Bingo!" Difficulty can be adjusted by using three sides of the board or cards with pictures and words or with only words.

boardgame.name: Skogen: Bäck Expansion
boardgame.description:
Play out new species and elements and rake in more points with the expansion Bäck!

This expansion let's you play Skogen with up to 6 players.

Contains: 3 brook trays 14 species trays, 5 element trays, 3 brook trays, 1 rule booklet, 2 life cards, 2 screens, 2 extra piece holders.

boardgame.name: The One Ring
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky,
Seven for the Dwarf-lords in their halls of stone,
Nine for Mortal Men doomed to die,
One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne
In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie.
One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them,
One Ring to bring them all, and in the darkness bind them,
In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie

Enter the world of Middle-earth with The One Ring™, the official tabletop roleplaying game based on the works of J.R.R. Tolkien. Designed specifically to evoke the atmosphere of The Hobbit™ and The Lord of the Rings™, the game contains rules for creating heroes and sending them off on adventures in a land threatened by the growing Shadow.

This beautifully illustrated, full-colour hardcover manual presents Middle-earth as it was twenty years after Bilbo Baggins’ remarkable disappearance and unexpected return. The great events narrated in The Lord of the Rings™ are still fifty years away, leaving plenty of room to narrate stories worthy of an epic.

Now in its second edition, The One Ring™ comes with updated and revised rules, a new visual style, and a focus on the land of Eriador — the Lone-lands west of the Misty Mountains. Among its key features are:

Rules for travelling across the land (Journey), facing frightening foes (Combat), and meeting the personalities of Middle-earth (Council).
Thorough advice for the Loremaster on how to bring Middle-earth to life, including rules for magical treasure, the Shadow, and the Eye of Mordor.
In-depth information on six Patrons — individuals sponsoring the adventures of the Player-heroes — including Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey.
A bestiary containing a spread of adversaries, from lowly Orc Soldiers and Highway Robbers, to monstrous Cave-trolls and Barrow-wights.
Rules to create your very own Nameless Things — unknowable beings from the dark corners of the world.
A complete Landmark adventure, The Star of the Mist, with extra support for new Loremasters, in the form of tutorial advice throughout.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The One Ring 2E: Anatomia di un successo annunciato

boardgame.name: Raid on Borgal's Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Raid on Borgal's Keep is a daring raid into the stronghold of an evil wizard and military general, to rescue a captured prisoner from its highest tower. Of course, General Borgal's keep is not lightly guarded, and his acquaintance with the local body snatcher no doubt signifies an undead menace lurking nearby...

This 12-page adventure utilizes the HackMaster 4th edition rules system and is designed for a 4th to 6th level party of four to six characters. It is set in the World of Aldrazar, in the Kingdom of Daurkhaud, a few miles north of the town of Gretch Willow [D7-01-D02] and only miles from the Rogue Haven border.

Note: Raid on Borgal's Keep was the first prize winner in our Knights of the Dinner Table Adventure Contest, and originally published in Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 150 - Apr 2009).

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: Unbreakable
boardgame.description:
Too Many Bones: Unbreakable is the standalone conclusion to the Too Many Bones franchise.

Join new characters Figment and Gale as they traverse the dangerous caverns beneath the land of Daelore using the game mechanics of Too Many Bones.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Too Many Bones: 40 Caves in Daelore
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Too Many Bones: Collapsible Dice Tower
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Too Many Bones: Crossover Loot Promo Pack
Too Many Bones: The Automaton of Shale
Too Many Bones: The Gearloc Child Promo
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Too Many Bones: Unbreakable Adventure Map
Too Many Bones: Unbreakable – Control ‘Ur Roll Dice Tray

Marvel Champions: El Juego de Cartas – The Vision Pack de Héroe

boardgame.name: Deadlands Lost Colony: Widowmaker
Viudanegra
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There are dozens, even hundreds, of permanent settlements in the Belt, in the form of either free-floating stations or habitats built onto the surface of the larger, more stable asteroids. The battered station Goliath’s Belt is still the single largest human habitation in the region, averaging over 3,000 souls on board at any given time, but several other settlements have populations that reach into the low four figures.

boardgame.name: Pregame Lobby (Issue 1 - Aug 2021)
boardgame.description:
It's Launch Day here at .dungeon HQ, and that means we have a launch event. The move from alpha to beta was huge and the influx of players was massive. But moving from beta to full-on-release is even bigger. This zine has everything you need to hop into the game Day 1 and catch up with those already in the game.

In the zine you'll find:


Your friend's list
A hex crawl
A fleshed-out town with NPCs
A launch event quest!
Some sick art

boardgame.name: Pregame Lobby (Issue 2 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
The first epic-tier quest just dropped for .dungeon! Travel to the Red Wastes and scour the desert for the biggest treasure hoard the game has ever seen. You'll navigate invisible pathways, swinging blades, and dangerous lizardmen to find it. And even when you find it, getting it out might prove to be the ultimate challenge.

In this zine you'll find:


A hex crawl of the Red Wastes
A 5-room dungeon
Cover at from @NateTreme
and the first issue of the .dungeon comic

boardgame.name: Blackbirds
boardgame.description:
A journal/solo/adventure game

Publisher's blurb:

Beyond being a guide to adventure, Blackbirds is a character creation game. Follow the steps in the book to create a unique character, root them in a fantastical world, and push them out the door onto adventure.

boardgame.name: Iron & Lies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Iron & Lies uses no dice and as a character your only tools are the lies you can tell and the blade you hold, if you can find one. The only thing certain in this game is that if you tell a lie to a fae of any kind, they believe it until given information to the contrary. And! That only an iron blade can physically harm a fae.

boardgame.name: My Body is a Cage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

My Body is a Cage is a game about balancing slice-of-life drama with dungeon crawling. During the day you live your normal life, going to school, working your job, trying to pay your bills and keep your head above water. But when you sleep you dream of a dungeon. And when you find coins in that dungeon, you wake up richer.

boardgame.name: The Globe / Mirelyn's Skyrealm
Two OSR Dungeon Crawls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here are two OSR-style dungeon crawls
...
The first ("The Globe") exists inside a snow globe, and features a tooth stealing witch, a sphinx looking for the answer to a riddle, and a nasty disease.

The second ("Mirelyn's Skyrealm") exists inside a witch's dream and features three strange witches, along with a unique day-night cycle that changes the encounters.

User summary:

Both scenarios are presented, back-to-back, in a single PDF document.

boardgame.name: Charge!: Eagles Rising
boardgame.description:
CHARGE! Eagles Rising allows you to recreate battles in the Napoleonic era from the tactical to grand tactical seamlessly.
It is a battalion level game that allows you to be an active participant whether you are the phasing or non-phasing player. You can expect historical realistic outcomes provided Napoleonic tactics are employed.

You can use your figurines mounted for Empire and Napoleon’s Battles in addition to many other popular games with no need to remount for playing this new system. You’ll be able to start utiizing this new approach rather quickly with minimum preparation.

The game has basic command and control, strategic movement, and higher unit morale (i.e. Division, Corps, Army), but keeps the individual unit moral to a minimum. This allows the game to be both strategic and tactical without bogging down
in endless details.

This game is based on the command of large formations with each turn representing 20-30 minutes of real time
and a scale of 1” equals 40-60yards.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Charge! Eagles Rising: Battle of Loubino (Valutina-Gora) – August 19 1812

boardgame.name: Charge! Eagles Rising: Battle of Loubino (Valutina-Gora) – August 19 1812
boardgame.description:
Russian General Barclay de Tolly on the evening of August 18, 1812 decided to pullout of the battle of Smolensk and continue the retreat to Moscow.
The Russian army got lost, and did not get far before the French advance guard found the rear guard of the Russian Army near the villages of Valutino, and Valutina-Gora.

This is a scenario booklet for Charge! Eagles Rising as this rearguard battle neared Loubino and the main line of retreat for the Russian army the morning of August 19, 1812.
This scenario has about 50,000 men per side and is at the battalion level.

This scenario can be adapted to any Napoleonic rules set.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trip to Cadbury's Game
boardgame.description:
A Trip to Cadbury's Game is an promotional advertising game produced by Cadbury's Chocolate in Australia during the 1960s.

The object of the game is to be the first player to arrive at the Cadbury's Chocolate factory in Tasmania, Australia.

Players roll a dice and move their colored token the number of spaces along roads around the Cadbury factory. Certain spaces link these concentric roads to smaller inner roads that is repeated until the final innermost road leads to the factory. Hazards encountered along the way can send players back to the start or miss a turn.

boardgame.name: Das Geheimnis von Holborn Hall
boardgame.description:
This escape game is all about a surprising last will and a mysterious mansion. The players take on the role of Emma Hart, who unexpectedly inherits the entire estate of deceased film icon Violet Hayward. The players explore the mysterious Holborn Hall estate together and have to solve various tasks.

The exciting journey leads through the mansion's rooms and each puzzle brings the group one step closer to the solution. For each room there is a hidden envelope, which may only be opened when you have reached this door in the game.

Behind the doors there are logic puzzles, riddles or picture and number tasks. The players can only master all the challenges and solve the mystery of Holborn Hall by working together as a team.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 5 Spieler Spieldauer: 90 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 12+
Das Geheimnis von Holborn Hall - Escape-Room-Spiel Ein verstorbener Filmstar, ein mysteriöses Erbe und ein verlassenes Anwesen: Schaffen Sie es, das Geheimnis von Holborn Hall zu lüften? Die Filmikone Violet Hayward hat Ihnen ihren gesamten Besitz vermacht, darunter auch das geheimnisvolle Anwesen Holborn Hall, auf dem sie die letzten Jahre abgeschottet lebte. Sie schlüpfen gemeinsam mit Ihren Mitspieler*innen in die Rolle der Erbin Emma Hart und bahnen sich nach und nach Ihren Weg durch die verschiedenen Zimmer der Villa. Dort warten jede Menge knifflige Rätsel und ungelöste Geheimnisse rund um das seltsame Testament des verstorbenen Leinwand-Stars. Die Uhr tickt – nur 75 Minuten haben Sie Zeit, um das großzügige Anwesen ganz genau zu erkunden und die vielen verschlüsselten Nachrichten zu knacken…
Dieses Escape-Game bietet Spannung und kniffligen Rätselspaß bis zur letzten Minute. Eine stimmungsvolle Geschichte und spannende Rätsel führen die Spieler*innen von Raum zu Raum. Dort warten einfache bis schwierige Aufgabenauf sie, die im Team mithilfe des detailreich gestalteten Spielmaterials gelöst werden müssen. Anders als bei anderen Escape-Games bleibt das Spielmaterial hier unversehrt und garantiert so grenzenlosen Spiel- und Rätselspaß. Nur wenn alle Rätsel gelöst sind, kann das Geheimnis gelüftet und das Mysterium um Violet Hayward entschlüsselt werden.
+ spannende Story + geeignet für Familien und Einsteiger*innen + überdurchschnittlich viel Spielmaterial + besonders geeignet für große Gruppen + Spielmaterial bleibt unversehrt und ist immer wieder verwendbar + tolle Extras enthalten: Faden- und Logikrätsel, Bilder- und Zahlenaufgaben
So wird’s gespielt: - Die Spieler*innen schlüpfen gemeinsam in die Rolle Emma Hart. Der verstorbene Leinwand-Star Violet Hayward hat Emma unverhofft seinen gesamten Besitz vermacht. - Die Spieler*innen erkunden als Gruppe das geheimnisvolle Anwesen, lösen zusammen verschiedene Rätsel und öffnen snach und nach die verschiedenen Räume von Holborn Hall. - Nur, wenn die Gruppe gut zusammenarbeitet und alle Hinweise richtig deutet, können sie das Geheimnis lüften und die Geschichte zu einem guten Ende bringen.
Inhalt 9 geheime Umschläge mit unterschiedlichen Materialien 5 Einladungen 1 Spielanleitung 1 Umschlag mit Lösungen 1 Umschlag zum Zurücksetzen
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Fallen Doll: Operation Lovecraft
boardgame.description: An adult game with VR support with Cthulhu mythos inspired

boardgame.name: Jewel Match Solitaire L'Amour
boardgame.description: Love is in the air. And so is Solitaire! Enter the enchanting world of Jewel Match as you fall head over heels for this charming new Solitaire adventure!

boardgame.name: Formula Team Manager
Race Pace
boardgame.description:
Formula Team Manager is a strategic race board game where you play the Team Manager of a race team in the most exciting racing class. As a Team Manager, it is your goal to lead the team to victory!

No race is the same: you can select from 6 teams, 7 drivers and 10 circuits. You have 4 different tyre compounds to choose from. Weather conditions will vary due to the built-in weather forecast and pitstops are a must in this game. All these features makes the game a fun and challenging experience.

Each team, each driver, each circuit and each tyre compound have their own characteristics. In addition, all drivers have a unique special skill, making it interesting to play the game again, with a different driver.

Gameplay
Before the race starts you decide which of the 10 circuits you are going to drive and every player selects a team and a driver. Make sure to check the weather forecast before you select a tyre compound to start the race.

Each game round:

Turn weather card
Each player selects an action for this game round. Upgrade your car to increase the speed, train your driver to avoid rookie mistakes (event cards), train your mechanics for faster pitstops, charge or use your boost system, defend, or let your teammate slow the competition down.
Turn event cards
Count your speed and move your car!


Make sure you have the best strategy and be the first to cross the finish line!

boardgame.name: Patalta
パタルタ (Pataruta)
boardgame.description:
Pataruta is a new take on the classic Japanese game of Karuta. The title of the game is a portmanteau of "pattern" and "karuta".

At the beginning of each turn, a card is flipped from the stack to create the winning conditions for the turn. The conditions include two parts and a Venn diagram. Depending on the Venn diagram, each of the two parts must be included or excluded from a card in order for it to fit the winning conditions.

The quickest player to find a card with the correct combination of parts wins the turn. If no cards match the conditions, the fastest player to pick up the condition card wins instead.

When there are no longer any cards left in the stack, the game ends. The player who has collected the most cards is the winner.

boardgame.name: イロトリトリ (Irotoritori)
boardgame.description:
In Irotoritori, players compete to be the quickest in finding bird cards that match both a condition card and a bird card which specify the color of parts composing a bird's body.

The player to find the most matching bird cards wins the round and gets to score points.

At the end of 5 rounds, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Heirlooms
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Heirlooms is a solo game about embodying and telling the story of a family heirloom - a set of dishes, a piece of artwork, a manuscript, a dresser, or something else entirely - passed from home to home and person to person, inherited over and over again, until eventually it can be passed down no longer. Tell the story of the family, catalogue your memories of them, and then...fade away. Nothing lasts forever.

boardgame.name: Disobey
boardgame.description:
Disobey is a semi-cooperative communication game inspired by John Carpenter's They Live.

During all phases of the game, it is strongly recommended to discuss, argue, try to convince your playing partners ... or manipulate them to achieve your goals. Anything goes! The only rule is that you cannot reveal your cards. You have to let the doubt hang out.

boardgame.name: The Gardener
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You are a creature of dirt and earth. You believe the best way a body can connect with their heart is through getting their hands in some dirt; you believe in community through cultivation - of ourselves, of each other, and of the plants and bugs that give us life.

You are alive. Your care is communal, verdant, and patient.

The Gardener is a playbook for use in Wanderhome, created for the beanie baby jam on the unofficial Wanderhome discord server.

boardgame.name: The Blackapple Brugh
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Blackapple is a small village on the edge of a great wood, near a brugh (an earthen mound) wherein is confined a cruel elf lord who once ruled the people of the village. He cannot leave the brugh, but is he truly no longer a threat? The Blackapple Brugh is a dark fairytale adventure for the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game. This adventure is intended for 4 to 6 player characters of levels 1 to 3.

boardgame.name: Circus of Illusions
boardgame.description: The Fourth Adventure from the Dungeons & Dragons and NERDS promotion. Includes the Character Sheet for "Green" as a Bard.

boardgame.name: Battle Song
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sounds of Battle!

Rule the airwaves of the vidnet and bring your allies' fighting fury to a fever pitch as you unleash the power of pure song to explore the harmonic resonance of the universe's supernal sound, reshaping reality with the power of rock! Unleash the resonant guard soldier fighting style to work in concert with cantors and other musical masters on the battlefield, or attune your own composition to the frequency of the elements, shadow, and aether with the massive warsinger archetype!

boardgame.name: Titans: King's miniature
boardgame.description: Kickstarter exclusive miniature that replaces the first player token.

boardgame.name: Action Force Strategy Game
boardgame.description:
Action Force Game is an exciting board game for 2 players based on the constant struggle for supremacy, between Action Force and Cobra Command, demanding military planning and tactical skills. It is played on the printed board (inside of the box), and involves combat on land, air and sea.

The object is to seize the enemies [sic] H.Q. using all the resources at your command. Each side has a different mix of vehicles and terrain, ensuring that every game presents new challenges...

description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kingdom of Fire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A foreign power is posing an existential threat to the Kingdom of Arabia as the new king prepares for war, and the PCs have only just so much time to protect their homeland. Ancient magics, Ifrit and royal politics all collide in this six chapter campaign adventure pack.

These six adventures are set in the Pax Lexque campaign world, which is detailed in the Pax Lexque Campaign Guide, available separately. The series begins at level 1 and progresses up to level 5-7. It includes 9 new monsters, 13 new spells and expands on 2 patrons from the campaign guide.

Also included are rules for handling mass combat between armies.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Professor Humbert Drumsley: Beautiful Rottenham
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5e city adventure kit, featuring the ponderous, oblivious, disastrous (and still suspended) Professor Humbert Drumsley!

Your regular gaming group absolutely loves your current campaign. Lots of quest, loads of loot, and tons of fun. But, maybe you need a bit of a break. A change of scenery. A vacation! Fear not, brave adventurers, it's time for a journey to the beautiful, sinking, sea-side city of Rottenham! It's a sure-fire catalyst for adventure, especially when you add Humbert into the mix!

Professor Humbert Drumsley: Beautiful Rottenham is a city adventure kit. Featuring the disastrous (but well intended!) Professor Humbert Drumsley, this book is a collection of locations, NPCs, short encounters, spells, and magic items compatible with the latest edition of the world's oldest fantasy roleplaying system. All of this content is designed to be fun, fast paced, and light hearted. Not only that, it's ideal for low level characters and ready to use at the table.

In Beautiful Rottenham, Humbert has made his way to the titular city, which is just ripe for adventure! Inside this book you'll find all sorts of campaign and adventure options, ready to bring to life at your table:

Find out what Professor Humbert Drumsley has been up to since arriving in Rottenham. Far more trouble than you'd have hoped!
Meet fascinating characters and visit fantastic locations. Adventure awaits!
Drop ready-made encounters into your campaign, perfect for low level characters. Hopefully they survive!
Dole out precious and priceless loot, with a collection of all-new magic items. They're almost completely safe!
Risk your life (and your eyebrows) with a few spells from Humbert's spellbook. Don't worry, they'll grow back!

boardgame.name: Humbert's Extra Appendix
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A compendium of advice, ideas, and sparks to ignite your campaigns with Professor Humbert Drumsley!

You love Professor Humbert Drumsley and you want to make him a larger part of your campaign. But where to start? Right here, dear friends! Humbert’s Extra Appendix is the perfect resource to expand your use of Humbert and the humor he brings with him.

Inside this book are even more tools to bring Humbert to life at your table. If you are starting a new campaign, or adding to your regular weekly game, this will give you more of what you need to run great games: inspiration!

Inside this book you will find:

Campaign advice: Learn how to insert Humbert in your campaign, set player expectations, and bring humor to the table. Draw focus on Humbert’s defining characteristics and use him to help bring your world to life.
Bonus adventure: Rescue the entire city of Weebridge from Humbert’s latest mishap in Marvelous Mind Machine! When a telepathy machine unexpectedly gains sentience and swaps everyone’s minds, only a group of true (albeit reluctant) heroes can return everything back to normal.
Quest hooks: Need a way to get your players back out into the world? Choose from a collection of adventure seeds sure to spark curiosity! These are perfect for crafting an extended quest or side trek.
Locations and NPCs: Learn even more about the city of Weebridge through the eyes of Humbert’s former apprentice, Alann Crock! But don’t take everything he says at face value, Humbert left more than a mark on his mind!
Fearsome creatures: There’s little better than an adventure with a new and exciting creature. Spice up your sessions with these story-driving creatures and let your imagination run wild!
And much, much more!

boardgame.name: Hall of Mirrors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A short 5e side-trek adventure suitable for a party of 4 5-6th level characters!

You're in the middle of a major campaign. It's long, involved, and takes tons of prep. Now you're just hours away from your next session, and you don't have anything ready. Fear not! The Hall of Mirrors is just what you need!

A strange map that can only be read in the reflection of a mirror leads to the treacherous Shattered Ruin. Some tell a tale of a shimmering, reflective palace fallen into disrepair. The map is unmistakably alluring, as is the prospect of lost wonders within the palace.

Inside this adventure you will find:

Hazards of the Hall: A dangerous location that features a fractured reality!
4 dangerous creatures: This adventure uses unique creatures and statblocks crafted specifically for it. All of these are contained within – no need to reference another book just to run an adventure!
3 new magic items: Reward your players with some fancy new loot! If they survive!

boardgame.name: Oh, I Hate Spiders!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh, I Hate Spiders! - A short FREE 5e adventure for 3 to 5 characters at 3rd level

Oh, I Hate Spiders! is a 2-hour 5e OGL adventure, suitable for 3-5 characters at 3rd level. Here the characters meet the ponderous, oblivious, disastrous (and recently suspended) Professor Humbert Drumsley. And, of course, he needs help with something. God, he always needs help with something. Ok fine, just one more time!

Humbert was studying a sac of phase spider eggs in the basement of a local tavern, when he suddenly had to abandon his research. Because they were about to hatch. But don't worry, he didn't tell anyone. Probably everything is just fine, these things have a way of working themselves out. Well, now the entire place is infested, the tavern is empty, and the building is filled with ethereal fog!

"Just bring back a few live specimens," he says. "It'll be easy," he says. Humbert. What a thoughtless jerk.

Inside this adventure you can find:

Professor Humbert Drumsley – Introduce your players to Humbert, a error-prone mage, and a sure-fire catalyst for adventure
Copper Carrot Tavern – The local tavern, run by the bartender Margo, and the site of the phase spider hatchling infestation. The adventure also features a map of the ground level of the building
3 all-new magic items – Arm your players with a bag of wardstones and some wardstone jars. They may even decide to buy the phase belt (no refunds!)
A side-trek romp – Take some of the pressure of your campaign with a fun little side trek. Don't worry, the characters can't do much more damage than Humbert already has...

boardgame.name: Dynamic Action!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dial The Action Up To 11!

Spice up your game with a mix of exciting and energized rules and feats! The contents of this book are a great way to add some anime-inspired energy to Pathfinder 2!

Includes

The Desperation System: When the chips are down and your back’s to the wall, call upon these amazing moves to turn the tide! Unleash powerful finishing moves and dramatic reversals of fortune!
3 New Subsystems: These easy-to-use rules allow you to change up the feel of combat! Includes rules for going first when you kick the door down, having a kill-or-be-killed dying state, and rules for dynamic teamwork actions!
New Feats: 10+ class feats open to all classes, with brand-new keywords to really spice things up!
Berserk: Damn the torpedoes, full speed ahead! These actions are strong, but inflict an AC penalty.
Flash: Act before others can think! Flash actions occur at the start of the round, before the normal initiative order.
Sudden: Don’t blink, you might miss it. Sudden actions happen so fast they don’t trigger reactions.

boardgame.name: Trailside Ruins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever have your player characters just take off into the jungle . This short adventure is set in ruins along the side of a jungle gametrail. This mini advventure may be set by the Game-master on any island with a tropical or subtropical jungle. It can be played as a short stand alone adventure or added into a larger campaign.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: Terror at Wulf's Head (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mining community of Wulf’s Head is under attack! Crawling horrors have burst from the frozen earth to attack the miners and their camp, far down the Savage River. Word has been sent by raven to the small town of Three Rivers. Will your characters respond to the call for aid… and can they get there in time?

Terror at Wulf’s Head is a Norse-flavored adventure designed by prolific author Ken Spencer. The action takes place in The Lost Lands’ Northlands setting (also available from Frog God Games). Bundle up! It’s frigid where the miners need your assistance. After all, there is no such thing as bad weather, only bad choice in clothing.

boardgame.name: Terror at Wulf's Head (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mining community of Wulf’s Head is under attack! Crawling horrors have burst from the frozen earth to attack the miners and their camp, far down the Savage River. Word has been sent by raven to the small town of Three Rivers. Will your characters respond to the call for aid… and can they get there in time?

Terror at Wulf’s Head is a Norse-flavored adventure designed by prolific author Ken Spencer. The action takes place in The Lost Lands’ Northlands setting (also available from Frog God Games). Bundle up! It’s frigid where the miners need your assistance. After all, there is no such thing as bad weather, only bad choice in clothing.

boardgame.name: Brass: Birmingham / Lancashire – Eurohell Design Insert
boardgame.description:
Lancashire or Birmingham with super-fast setup, vertically storable, language-neutral and transport-safe.

Special boards front to set up players in seconds. Save yourself the hassle of placing the individual tiles at the beginning of the game. Safely store the industries in the box and then just turn over and start playing. We have also thought about the market the cube dispenser fills the coal and iron market with one click.

Lancashire gets a player-count-adjusted card as well as trade tray, which can be prepared for 2, 3 or 4 players.

boardgame.name: Cold Wind Whispering
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A Science-ish Fantasy pathcrawl that takes place on a frozen mountainside in the cold regions of your campaign world.

Featuring 17 keyed locations, 3 dungeons, unique monsters, rules for handling the cold weather and much more.

Compatible with your OSR game of choice without much converting.

Enjoy!

boardgame.name: Middara: FancyButFictional Player Dashboard
boardgame.description:
Player board for Middara.

Supports sleeved cards
It compresses the required play area to a roughly A4-sheet zone.
Magnetized dials are used to keep track of character stats
Cutting down on token usage
Sideboards are foldable, they are kept in place by using wooden rails and magnets.
Sideboards can even be extended beyond the table edges without falling out. - Possible to exhaust cards.
Colored tokens are separately buyable, so that you always know your Conviction and Casting dices
Save your character: no need to de-setup and re-setup characters, keep everything in the tray.
Lightweight (~400g assembled), made from non-heavy wood.

boardgame.name: Bricks Breaker
Bricks Breaker Plus
Bricks Breaker Pro
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Over 500 levels of breaking ball fun

boardgame.name: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh, beautiful for spacious skies

Skies that are colored gray, not like that of a dead channel, but from rain trying in vain to wash away the grime and evil of the streets below.

For amber waves of grain

Grain used to make “food” to feed America’s 430+ million people; and of course, the fatcats still get the first — and sometimes the only — mouthfuls.

For purple mountains’ majesties

That the average person will never get to see, because they’re too busy with their noses to the grindstone, pleasing their corporate masters. If the skies were even clear enough, that is.

Above the fruited plain

At least those plains that haven’t been devastated by the worsening weather events brought on by climate change.

America, America

No longer exists in a recognizable form, ever since becoming a mere fascist shell of itself under the boot heel of an ascendant China.

God shed his grace on thee

The gods now live above the masses in their mighty towers of polycarbon and glass, imposing their will through tyrannical (and compliant) politicians and legions of armored federal agents.

And crown thy good with brotherhood

There’s very little good in the world anymore and “brotherhood” is a joke. There is only destroy or be destroyed, succeed or fail...and the system is rigged to make you fail.

From sea to shining sea

Which (also thanks to climate change) comes a little closer every year, flooding once-habitable land.

New World is a cyberpunk campaign framework based on the Traveller SRD (which is itself based on The Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game published in the 1970s) and the Cepheus Engine SRD. Set in the middle of the 21st century in an America rendered almost unrecognizable by past events, the campaign features many of the tropes commonly expected in a cyberpunk world, along with some developed expecially for New World:

A timeline based on and extrapolated from real-life events
A familiar lifepath character generation system
A generous selection of cybernetic modifications, mundane equipment, and vehicles
Simplified rules for computer use and cyber-combat
A discussion of mid-21st century American life and culture, including a glossary of slang terms
A look at the changes wrought on America and the rest of the world
A system for mapping sections of the “Net (aka cyberspace)
A system for determining spontaneous radicalization, one of the worst scourges of the future age
And much, much more


It’s a new world, just around the corner. Welcome to the future, daoren…hope you survive it!
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: Garden of Rain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Garden of Rain' is designed as a HARP Fantasy' adventure module for 4 or more characters of 5th or 6th level. It is also statted for Rolemaster Classic and Rolemaster Fantasy Roleplaying.

The community of Vallegarde, a once prosperous village in a remote mountain valley, is beset by freak rainstorms that threaten to drown all its inhabitants in an unstoppable flood. Arriving in the nick of time, daring adventurers have the chance to save the villagers from watery
death and win a temporary reprieve. Unravelling the mystery behind the unceasing rains and thwarting the supernatural foes of Vallegarde will be a test of wits, martial prowess and magic for true heroes.

Garden of Rain may be used as a standalone adventure module to slot into the GM's existing campaign world, but it also forms the first in a sequence of adventure modules pitting player-characters against an evil cult.

boardgame.name: Entrance to the Valley of Kings (part 1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 55.68 is the second in the Populated Hexes Monthly series, and takes a look at a sea-side desert hex containing a complex once used by the Crocodile Kings to mummify and inter their dead royals, as well an entrance into the box canyon containing many tombs holding the dead. Part 1 provides a broad overview of the hex as well as rules for creating undead; either in game by PCs or for Referees to create their own new undead.

boardgame.name: Template: Rebirth/Undying
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many superheroes have a surprising ability to return from the dead. For those who find no eternal rest, only a momentary respite in the grave, return to the world of the living good as new. Often, their return from the dead can bring tears of joy along with the perplexity and bewilderment of their friends, allies, loved ones and foes. Other times, in settings where superhero’s returning from death is a commonplace thing, resurrection and rebirth is a standard affair of daily life!

boardgame.name: Cube
boardgame.description:
In Cube, two to four players try to recreate the color combinations of their task cards on the game board. Whoever first fulfills the required number of cards wins.

The situation on the game board changes with every turn. The active player can choose to either place a blindly-drawn wooden cube on the board or to move an already-placed cube to a different space.

A ball recessed at the bottom of the game board makes it easy to rotate the board in all directions, and the different perspectives — from above or from one of the four sides — allow for multiple possibilities of fulfilling a task card for all players, whether it's their turn or not. If the cubes on the game board lie on different levels or in different rows, the viewing direction is crucial. Cubes hidden from view don't count.

boardgame.name: The Thingonomicon II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crammed full of over two years’ worth of 20 Things articles, The Thingonomicon II is an essential resource for the time-crunched GM striving to add depth and verisimilitude to their game. Comprising over 220 pages of detail-heavy, system neutral tables The Thingonomicon II can be used either both or during the game session.

If your campaign features abnormal lesser undead, alchemist's laboratories, archives and libraries, bandits and brigands, besieged castles, black dragon lairs, blue dragon lairs, fairs and festivals, fanes of evil, farming villages, fecund jungles, ghostly hauntings, green dragon lairs, items most wondrous, lich's lairs, local landmarks, minions of evil, noisome marshes, orc villages, red dragon lairs, ruined castles, ruined cities, ruined monasteries, ruined wizard's towers, shadowed borderlands, smugglers' villages, snow and ice, sunken ships, torture chambers, travellers' inns, urban chases, vampire's castles, white dragon lairs, windswept moors and wrecked ships (and whose doesn’t?) The Thingonomicon II is for you!

boardgame.name: Ordinary Places
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ordinary Places is a great resource for Players and DMs to "see" more of fantasy realms.

What's in Ordinary Places?

Illustrations and maps of 10 places which are typical for any fantasy setting and are very handy for any GM with players who turned right instead of turning left.

Each place consists of two parts. The first is notebook for DM and consists of sized maps and illustrations of each location mentioned above.

The second part is a set of handouts ( a map (with and without Grid) and an illustration of each location) which can be easily printed or presented to players during a session, in order to enrich the locale's description and create a more precise presentation.

boardgame.name: Peak
boardgame.description:
When you move in Peak, you must always jump over TWO playing pieces. These pieces may lie on the board on top of one another, next to one another, or with a distance between them — all options are possible, but you must jump over exactly TWO pieces, not more, not less. Unoccupied spaces are ignored; you can jump over them or use them as destination spaces. If the chosen destination space already contains a playing piece, you stack the new piece on top.

At the end of the game, the piece on top of a tower determines who scores for this tower; each playing piece is worth one point. The player who stacks best and is thus able to claim the most pieces wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pugilist Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet The Pugilist: an unarmed-focused brawler with all the right moves.

You are a Pugilist, a two-fisted prize fighter who resolutely steps up to the mark no matter how bloodied. Through the strength of your resolve and the application of the “sweet science,” you face down foes both human and supernatural.

A Victorian-themed character class compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system ready for your gaslight setting. Included in the Gaslight Characters: Volume I, This character can fit into any campaign world with Gothic themes, Steampunk trappings, or 19th century urban vibes.

boardgame.name: Crimson Escalation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long story short, this kicks ass! Plus, I included 10 rules for better immersion.

Ok, what is Crimson Escalation?

I was looking for a way to make my D&D combat fast, realistic, and exciting. I put forth a few ideas, but my friend Rob Couture had the idea of increasing the critical-hit range every round. I took his idea and ran with it.

Included in this PDF is the cover image, Rob Couture's foreword, an explanation of the Crimson Escalation mechanic, a visual aid "tracker" so you always know what crits, some cool artwork and layout, my Ten Commandments of Immersion, and the credits.

boardgame.name: Habt 8
boardgame.description:
The task cards show color combinations, and your objective is to recreate these by placing wooden blocks in these colors on the gameboard. The white joker is very helpful for that. On each turn, you may either blindly draw a block out of the bag or relocate a block that is already on the board.

Playing this game fosters spatial vision in combination with concentration – and with fun.
The first player to fulfill the 8 task cards wins.

It seems to be a lightwEIGHT game – but both players need to stay alert, since a good chance of completing a task can be blocked quickly.

boardgame.name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – 5th Extension
Die Klinik: Deluxe-Ausgabe – Die 5. Erweiterung
boardgame.description:
Occasionally, I’ve heard it said that some players build their clinic nearly the same way every time, and that the construction part of the game lacks variety. So, in The Extension, I added Urban Design 1.0 to require different floor plans, and Underground Utility Work to reduce the available space and to resize and reconfigure your player boards however you want. Then, in the 3rd Extension, I added Urban Design 2.0.

But still… you have all become veterans of all of these obstacles, and now you need more!

So, I offer you new layouts for the ground floor, and a new series of double tiles, which should not only accelerate development of your clinic, but also allow you to play on these more difficult floors — plenty to get you out of your rut!

—From the introduction of the rulebook

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Gunz and Bullitz: Armz and Armor Catalogue
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In this catalogue, you’ll find:


DOZENS of new weapons that will blow your competition away (literally).
BUNCHES of new and exciting Perks to make your character feel even MORE powerful and specialized.
PLETHORAS of different apparel, supplies, and BioTech.
EXTENSIVE lore from introductions of each catalogue seller, as well as a dozen Legendary NPCs you can add to your game!

boardgame.name: Neon Nights
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Jeriko City, everybody wants to be somebody. Who do you wanna be?

Neon Nights is a cyberpunk/dystopian tabletop RPG set on Earth after a nuclear war devastated the entire planet. After hundreds of years of thousands of people roaming the desolate, irradiated Great Wastes, megacities emerged from the dust of deserts. Where there was once crumbling roads and dancing dust devils now stand skyscrapers towering over hundreds of thousands of roaming pedestrians walking the streets of Jeriko City, located on the East Coast of the once powerful United States of America.

boardgame.name: VFDB: A Village, a Forest, a Dungeon, a Beast
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You find yourself in a small village perched at the edge of a mysterious forest. These peasants are threatened by monsters emerging from an ancient dungeon: the lair of a fell beast.

A VILLAGE, A FOREST, A DUNGEON, A BEAST (VFDB) provides a rules-lite, minimalist framework for tabletop fantasy roleplay. It presumes you know the basics of the genre, fundamentals of tabletop roleplaying, and are comfortable ad-libbing. It’s meant to be simple, fast, and fun and broadly compatible with most old school modules. VFDB does not do the work for you: It helps you get started doing it yourself.
boardgame.rpg: VFDB: A Village, a Forest, a Dungeon, a Beast

boardgame.name: Stilicho: Last of the Romans – Canvas Map
boardgame.description: Premium canvas map that is durable and easy-to-read. Replicates/replaces the standard paper map.

boardgame.name: The Trip!: The Infamous Game
boardgame.description:
"Are you ready for a psychedelic journey? Fill up on alcohol and drugs and set off on the most infamous rat race in history."

The Trip! is a cruel fight based on recklessness, drugs and a lot of infamy.

To win you must be the first to reach the 250km that separates you from the finish. You will be able to move on the course thanks to the VEHICLE cards and the BOOSTER cards.

Get special abilities by carrying PASSENGER cards and increased speed by accumulating bonuses from DOPING cards, but beware! overdosing will make you lose everything.

If your opponent is running too fast, tip the law enforcement and throw them a ROADBLOCK or use ACTION cards to punish that poor bastard!

boardgame.name: Reign in Hell: The Oculus Spear – solo and co-op expansion
boardgame.description:
Reign in Hell: The Oculus Spear is a solo & co-op expansion for Reign in Hell, the miniatures-agnostic tabletop wargaming ruleset about demons battling in the remains of Hell.
This expansion includes a six-part campaign that you can play alone or co-op with a friend.
You'll explore Hell for the Oculus Spear, a Relic of great power that could potentially turn the tides of Hell. Can you survive the campaign and Reign in Hell?

Designed by wargaming YouTube nerds Adam Loper (Tabletop Minions) and Vince Venturella (Warhammer Weekly) - Reign in Hell is designed as a fun, quick skirmish game that allows you to play using the demon models you may already have from many different fantasy games out there, or build (or 3D print) new ones to make your cabal exactly the way you envision. The campaign system is robust, and allows for growth and customization for your demons as they gain Titles and discover Relics and Essences to increase their powers.

You must have the main ruleset Reign in Hell to use this expansion.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Reign in Hell: Demonic Skirmish Combat

boardgame.name: Munus
boardgame.description:
As a concept, gladiatorial combat is one of the more horrible ideas that humans have come up with. However, it certainly has a morbid and primal appeal. Even the Saintly Augustine of Hippo observed how quickly one could become drunk on the sights, sounds, and bloodshed of the Roman Games.

Munus is a set of rules designed to stage a miniature recreation of gladiatorial combat.
The core rules are intended to be streamlined so that two players, with a sound understanding of the rules, can string several half-hour games together in a single game session.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Megadungeon (#6 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sixth issue of Megadungeon is upon us!

Dungeon adventures, two new dragons, and resources suitable for any campaign! Dual-statted for Basic Dungeons & Dragons and 5e. Come explore the Stone Head of Baldur! Meet interesting people and kill them!

Articles on making dungeons exciting, the megadungeon in campaign and weekly play, and the megadungeon as sport, and the party fish-bro's the Dagon! Have some brewskies before the end of all things man! Also contains an advertiser section highlighting some of the best and most interesting projects in the realm of classic gaming!

boardgame.name: Sensuikan: Japanese Fleet Submarines in WW2
boardgame.description:
Sensuikan: Japanese Fleet Submarines, 1941-45 is a solitaire, tactical level game that places you in command of a Japanese Fleet submarine from Pearl Harbor until the end of the war in 1945.
After choosing a class, your mission is to conduct special missions as assigned by the Combined Fleet.
The player will take his submarine on assigned missions with the objective to complete said missions, as opposed to necessarily sinking merchant vessels (although that is sometimes an objective).
You will be advancing your crew quality and increasing your commander’s rank and awards—all while remembering you have to make it home amidst diminishing odds of survival as the war progresses.

Players will find it extremely challenging to survive an entire tour from 1941 to 1945, at which time, if still alive, you will surrender at port, having done your part on the front lines.

A fascinating historical addition to Sensuikan is three new modules: the Aircraft Module, the Midget Sub Module, and the Kaiten (suicide torpedo) Module. These modules facilitate play if a player is assigned to a submarine that is equipped with one of these special capabilities.

The system is packed with rich technical detail based on the various submarine classes used by Japan. There are no less than 17 classes of submarine to choose from. These include:

Types A, B, C
Junsen (3 classes)
Kirai-Sen Class
Kaidai (5 classes)
Type B. 3 and Type C. 3
Sen-Toku and Sen-Taka Classes
Type A (Modified)


The different classes have historical equipment, sometimes including aircraft in watertight hangars, midget submarines, and later in the war, suicide torpedoes. You may be assigned to special missions based on your class’s capabilities – perhaps a midget submarine attack on Pearl Harbor or Australia, the bombing of the U.S. west coast, or possibly even an attack on the Panama Canal.

Besides the focus on hardware, the human aspect of the war is captured as the submarine Commander (the player) and his crew can improve over time via skills acquisition. In addition to having combat modules to facilitate ease of play, the game includes a major change by including the “Major Event” markers that track the war’s progress and possibly involve the player in supporting the Major Events as they occur.

Gameplay moves quickly, following a set sequence of events that are repeated until the end of the game. Once you have your initial assignment, your submarine goes on patrol, randomly rolling for events and encounters. Special emphasis is placed on successfully conducting any operations assigned to you by Higher Command, as implemented by the “Major Event” marker system. Although sinking enemy shipping is always encouraged, the game’s primary goal is to conduct operations as assigned to support the Main Force Fleet or other ongoing significant military operations.

This game should be highly accessible to those familiar with the The Hunters or Silent Victory game systems and is meant to be a historical yet highly playable and exciting solitaire game covering Japanese fleet boat operations in World War II.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Atlantic Sentinels: North Atlantic Convoy Escort, 1942-43
boardgame.description:
Atlantic Sentinels is a solitaire, tactical level game placing you as the Senior Officer of the Escort, shepherding a convoy in the North Atlantic from the attacks of U-boats, both singly and in wolfpacks.
You are in command of a convoy escort group, composed typically of 4-10 escort vessels guarding a convoy on its way across the Atlantic.
Your mission is to protect as much Allied shipping as possible while simultaneously destroying as many U-boats as possible during the height of the U-boat threat – 1942 to early 1943.

Atlantic Sentinels provides players with a host of decisions as he is assigned to protect merchant convoys, typically ranging from 40 to 60 ships. The placement of escorts to offer front, rear, and flank protection to the convoy is complicated by the size of the convoy and available assets. Additional decisions must be made on where to place the escorts, which are equipped with Type 271 radars, the key to your defense.

As the game progresses, a player’s Escort Group may receive upgrades in the form of additional radars, HF/DF (High-Frequency Direction Finding) equipment, and possibly additional ships. Air support can be key, but until the CVE “jeep carriers” arrive, the “Black Pit” in the center of the Atlantic remains a high threat area.

Players will find it highly challenging to minimize convoy losses and keep them to an acceptable level.

Players may choose any of 9 historical Escort Groups (five British, four Canadian) armed with historical destroyers and corvettes.

These ships include:

B/C/D/E Classes DE
F Class DE
H Class DE
V&W Class DE
Town Class DE (American Lend Lease)
River Class FF
Flower Class Corvettes


Gameplay moves quickly, following a set sequence of events that are repeated until the end of the game. Once your initial Escort Group is set up, play proceeds by rolling for a convoy and escorting it across the Atlantic. Enemy forces range from single U-boats (typically a type VII, but possibly a Type IX) to entire wolfpacks. Wolfpacks increase in size (as they did historically) and will be your primary challenge. Encounters are randomly generated, ensuring no two careers will ever be the same. Weather can impact operations, as well as air support and crew upgrades due to experience. A logical but reasonably simple set of instructions bring the U-boats in to attack you from random directions, making your initial defensive array very important.

Of particular note is the game is designed to integrate with The Hunters if players wish to combine the games.

Atlantic Sentinels: North Atlantic Convoy Escorts, 1942-43 is meant to be a highly playable and interesting solitaire game covering the actions an Escort Group would have to deal with in fighting the U-boat peril during convoy escort.

Product Information:
Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 10 out of 10 (solitaire game design)
Time Scale: Semi-abstract (Convoy escort missions, 2 per month)
Map Scale: Abstract
Unit Scale: Individual escorts, U-boats, merchant ships (when targeted)
Players: One (with option for two)
Playing Time: 15 to 20 minutes (single mission), 6-8 hours (full career)

—description from the publisher

The Hunters: German U-Boats at War, 1939-43

boardgame.name: Battletech: Clan Fire Star
boardgame.description:
A withering fusillade of firepower from the Clans' technologically advanced OmniMechs can cut a swath through even the mightiest wall of defenders. The superior firepower of these designs gives a Clan commander an even greater edge.

Unleash the Clan Fire Star on your enemies! Warhawk, Nova Cat, Cougar, Kit Fox and Fire Moth—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for Battletech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Is or Isn't
boardgame.description: In Is or Isn't, players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawns around the gameboard. When they land on a word card space, all players look to identify the matching synonym or antonym on their bingo boards and cover that square with a token. Landing on a challenge space provides the player an opportunity to choose any open square on their board and place a token if they successfully complete the challenge. The first player to fill a row or column with four tokens wins the game.

boardgame.name: Dandelions
boardgame.description:
Transform into a dandelion, and float through clear blue skies on a pleasant breeze in this dice-rolling, area-majority game with a little direct-competition edge. Your quest is to find the best spots for your seeds to grow across a variety of vibrant, beautiful, and cozy gardens.

In Dandelions, players roll a group of dice, then choose one to move to a beautiful garden. Along the way, you can harness the power of the wind with three special actions — float, puff, and gust — to get the most points. The game ends after all the dice are used, and whoever receives the most victory points as combined from two different scoring methods wins.

boardgame.name: East Asia Expansion: Buddha Era 1800
boardgame.description:
East Asia Expansion - Buddha Era 1800 is a board game based on the trade of East and Southeast Asian venues around the 13th century.

The aim of the game is to increase your own wealth by investing in and managing trading groups in countries without a player map.
In the later stages of the game, you can also invest in visitors such as Japanese pirates and European powers, which allow you to make money while interfering with other nations' trade routes.
The player with the most assets at the end of the game wins.

The game takes place in the 13th century and is based on the maritime trade in East and Southeast Asia. The game is not about railways, but about investing in trading groups of countries to earn money. The main differences between this game and the usual 18xx game are that there are no railway tiles in the sea. Instead, you can use "route blocks" to expand your routes. In this period of Asian maritime trade, there are obstacles such as Japanese pirates and European powers. The game is played in a number of different ways. The number of turns is predetermined. There is no "Bankruptcy is the end of the game" rule. The game is similar to Poseidon, but a bit more 18xx.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Come
boardgame.description:
Africa is the cradle of civilization and home to the greatest kingdoms in the world! Lead your kingdom to supremacy through your prowess in tactical movement, the market, kingdom management, and military might. However, your ascendancy is being threatened by other kingdoms. Not to mention, there are monsters invading from the Realm! You can choose to battle these rival kingdoms or form alliances with them to fend off the monster hordes. Also, if your leader defeats a monster, then your leader can capture it for you to use in future battles. History is in the making! Time is short. There are multiple paths to victory but only one kingdom may be victorious. How will your kingdom be remembered?

The goal of Kingdom Come is to have the most victorious kingdom in Africa! You will lead your kingdom to victory by set collection and accumulating victory points over the course of 3-5 periods. During each period, you will position your military across Africa, go to the market to buy upgrades, and manage your kingdom, all in preparation to battle monsters and other players' kingdoms. The player with the most victory points at the end of all periods wins the game!

Kingdom Come is a celebration of the history, diversity, and cultures of Africa. It is driven by ubuntu philosophy and features a strong emphasis on empathic user-centered design. Thus, in Kingdom Come, you will feel welcomed, victorious, and motivated to win to the very end.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Firebeast. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the November 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Battle Of Midway
boardgame.description:
Blood Red Skies is a tabletop miniatures game in which you take command of a force of fighter aircraft in battle. The emphasis in Blood Red Skies is on controlling a large number of planes at once. Action in the game is fast-paced, with no pre-plotting or book-keeping required. A smallish game of Blood Red Skies, with six planes per side, can be fought in forty-five minutes or less.

A force is comprised of iconic World War 2 fighter aircraft using the dynamic ‘Advantage’ system. Opposing pilots can also use card-based aircraft traits, doctrines, Ace skills and theatre rules to make the most of their planes and fighting environment.

The Battle of Midway starter set contains everything you need to get playing, including rules, tokens, dice, game cards, and crucially 12 highly detailed Warlord Resin aircraft with which to battle.

The Grumman F4F Wildcat When the US Navy and Marine Corps entered the Second World War, they had only one effective fighter aircraft available to them: the F4F Wildcat. Fortunately, the Wildcat proved more than equal to the task of holding the line.

The Mitsubishi A6M2 ‘Zero’ The Mitsubishi A6M Zero was a fast, modern fighter, but had no armour for the pilot. When the Zero (derived from the Japanese name Reisen - meaning Zero Fighter) was in the hands of aggressive and well-trained pilots this weakness was rarely apparent.

The US aircraft are provided in blue-coloured resin and the Japanese in white/cream, making your squadrons easily distinguishable and able to launch into furious tabletop dogfights even before you touch paint to model.

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Imperial Japanese Air Force
Game: Blood Red Skies – United States Army Air Forces

boardgame.name: Catch Sketch
Doodly Quickly
캐치 스케치
boardgame.description:
Catch Sketch is a speed drawing game. You have to draw images to explain a keyword as quick as possible. The active player will guess the keyword by looking at the images of the fastest player. But, if he makes a wrong guess, the chance to get a score will passed to the next fastest player. So be quick, but draw recognizable images to win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arcane Conversions
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The powers in Pathfinder for Savage Worlds are broad enough to cover several different Pathfinder spells. By combining the base power with specific trappings and some Power Modifiers, you will find you can mimic most any effect you are trying to replicate.

Illustrating this method with some well-known Pathfinder spells, these Arcane Conversions provide a blueprint to help you translate other spells.

boardgame.name: Last Stand at Camp Starfall
boardgame.description:
An Adventure of Horror on Multiple Levels

From the introduction:

It has been weeks since the last communication from jungle site VF426, known as Camp Starfall. Does anything yet stir at the camp? Will you reclaim the artifacts your employer seeks? Will your soul be torn apart by things your mind was not meant to contemplate? You bet.

Designed for 4th-level characters

User summary:

Includes conversion notes for adapting the scenario to Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition)

boardgame.name: Wellerman
boardgame.description:
You captain a 19th century Weller Brothers supply ship. Your Wellerman sails from Dunedin, New Zealand with four cargo holds which carry sugar, tea, or rum. Use available wind cards to beat the other captains to the destinations where your cargo is currently the most prized. But, the more money your ship earns on a run, the more your crew drinks on shore leave... and jolly crews are slow to return to sea.

Win the game by gathering the most coin before the last sailing season.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Chromatics
boardgame.description:
Business is booming for local artisans and as assistants at the local paint shop, you and your opponent must race to meet their urgent requests! Carefully manage your inventory of colors, invest at the right time to obtain useful bonuses and abilities, and assemble sets to fulfill the requirements for rare and valuable color swatches.

Chromatics is a tight, two-player strategy game about colors. In a fresh twist on established game mechanics, each player's resources - red, blue, and yellow "primary color cubes" - also function as the "workers" used to secure positions around a contested 4x4 grid of cards. Each round, players place cubes from their inventory on various border cards, before deciding to take one of two actions:


investing cubes, allowing players to build up their supply of colors, or
spending cubes, obtaining a wide variety of action cards featuring inventive abilities and lucrative scoring bonuses


When each round ends, players are also provided an opportunity to purchase vibrant paint swatches, further adding to their score - but depleting their inventory of resources at the same time. At the end of the game, players tally their scores. Most points is the winner!

Featuring an approachable art style, a creative blend of mechanics familiar to veteran players, and a variety of cards to ensure no two games are alike, Chromatics is an exciting entry into the genre of two-player strategy games. Who knew colors could be so competitive?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Luck Be a Landlord
boardgame.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Luck be a Landlord is a roguelike deckbuilder about using a slot machine to earn rent money and defeat capitalism. This game does not contain any real-world currency gambling or microtransactions.

Features
Roguelite gameplay - The symbols you can add to the slot machine are different every time!
Lots of Symbols to add to your slot machine - Each symbol has different effects and interactions.
Plenty of Items to choose from - The items are different every time as well, leading to interesting build strategies.
A terrible landlord to defeat.
A dog you can pet.
Capitalism.

boardgame.name: Stackegories
boardgame.description:
Stackegories is a fast-thinking word microgame of stacking categories with four ways to play. The base mechanism is finding an answer that fits a restriction and relates to two categories. For example, what's something that Starts with C and is related to Food and School? Cafeteria!

With four ways to play, you can either:

Race your friends to be the first to find an answer.
Come up with the most answers for a grid of categories.
Outlast your opponents by finding answers to an increasingly restricted category.
Cooperate to find a secret answer by giving clues related to the categories.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Big Trouble
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Archmage Lich, Raddan Goss, has returned from the netherworld and once again threatens the security of Blackmoor. The Wizard’s Cabal’s most learned expert on the former arch enemy of Skelfer Ard is seeking brave adventurers to aid the Cabal in it’s time of need. Undertaking a journey to seek out a former associate of Raddan may be many things, but one thing is for certain, it will be Big Trouble.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor one round adventure for Players levels 5-13

The third installment in the series Thicker than Water... and Part 2 of the themed modules Episode 19: A Matter of Perspective.

WARNING: This adventure contains encounters that are untiered. Players enter at their own risk.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Brushfire
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sometimes your enemies show up in the places you least expect them. Sometimes you can find allies in those least able to help themselves. And sometimes, heroes rise to meet an insurmountable challenge and save the day.

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 3 - 9.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: The Hellward Annex
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Prisoners of war locked and bound, a research facility obscured now found; within the walls its secrets hidden, numerous experiments all forbidden. Existence denied investigations blocked, an organization ruined from the shock; the awakened caught and put to death angers their lord Insellageth.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor one round adventure for players levels 4-12.

Part four of the series Thicker than Water...
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: The Dawn of Goss
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Wizard’s Cabal appears glorious but it is made up of constant hard choices and unattractive tasks accepted under the pressure of Arcane Law. The powers in charge keep the people in a perpetual state of fear; keep them in a continuous stampede of fervor with the cry of the Arcane Inquisition. Always there has been some terrible evil to gobble us up if they did not blindly rally behind the Wizard’s Cabal by furnishing the exorbitant sums they demanded. Yet, in retrospect, these disasters seem never to have happened; seem never to have been quite real…until now.

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor one round adventure for players level 4-14.

Part five of the series Thicker than Water...
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Tin Helm
boardgame.description:
The Brotherhood of the Red Cloth long made their home deep in the abandoned mines of the Black Mountains. But sickness came upon them as they delved too deep, and their minds have been twisted and their attention has shifted to creating wicked evils. Darkness now lives here and only a true hero can cure the madness that has consumed all... Are you that hero?

Tin Helm is the little brother to the hit solo dungeon crawler Iron Helm. Tin Helm shares some mechanics with it's older brother, but applies many new twists. Tin Helm also is quite small in size and makes the perfect dungeon-on-the-go game. It literally fits in a shirt pocket.

boardgame.name: Retrieval
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For one hundred years the Wizard’s Cabal has ruled supreme over magic in Blackmoor armed their Arcane Foci and Skelfer Ard's Scale of Magical Energy. But Raddan Goss has struck the first blow in the new struggle for magical supremacy and has taken from the Cabal it’s most trusted resource; they need you to get it back.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor Dwoemer Realm High-Level Optional two round adventure for players levels 7-13.

This module is recommended for players who have previously participated in Episode 72: The Dawn of Goss and is the final installment in the series "What Lies Beneath..."

WARNING: This module contains UNTIERED encounters and is recommended for well balanced parties. Playing up is not recommended and can result in party death. Players enter at their own risk.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Cutty Black Sow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Something horrible stalks the dark streets of Maus. Nobles are being found torn apart and mutilated in back alleys and crucified on streetlamps. The Merchant’s Guild of Maus is nervous and seeks help from brave adventurers to solve the mystery of who or what is butchering the upper class of the biggest metropolitan city in the North.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor one round adventure for players levels 5-13.

The third installment of the series: “Infernal Darkness” and part of the themed modules, “The Businessmen of Blackmoor.”

WARNING: This adventure contains many adult themes and graphic circumstances; it is recommended for mature audiences. Player discretion is advised.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Teacher's Pet
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Can a student teach a former teacher os is this lesson too hard to swallow?

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 1-7.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Remembrance Day
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Memories of freedom are celebrated in a war torn land. The heroes are requested to gain freedom for slaves newly taken. Even those in the center of Blackmoor are not safe from the reach of the grasping Afridhi.

A one-round Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 7-12.

Episode four in the Holidays for Heroes series.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Friday the 13th: Horror at Camp Crystal Lake – Player Powers Promo Set
boardgame.description: These six player power cards will add to the excitement and drama of your game by giving unique abilities to each of the players.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Friday the 13th: Horror at Camp Crystal Lake

boardgame.name: Treasures of Nakbe
boardgame.description:
An expedition was organized to explore the ancient Mayan city ' Nakbe' for searching hidden treasures. Looking for the treasure, the expedition arrived in the middle of the temple. However, their arrival woke up the god "Ekchua" who was resting there.
Everyone must take flight whilst trying to grab many treasures! Roll dice and move expeditions. When expedition member arrival to the space with treasures, player who move the expedition member will get the treasure. But hide which member you are.
If you don't hide which member who you are, your member will be the first to face the fury of the god. Move wisely to get treasures and runaway from the Ekchua!

—description from the publisher
