boardgame.name: Fragmentz
boardgame.description:
Fragmentz is recreation of fast-paced Korean poker/card game called Go-Stop. With the Fragmentz deck players can play two types of games which are Go-Stop and Gree.

Go-Stop, The goal of Go-Stop is to capture cards from a central layout by playing a card of the same realm(landscape). The aim is to collect scoring combinations among the cards captured. When a player's captures have a sufficient value, the player can 'stop' the game and claim payment, or can continue the game ('go') taking the risk with hope of winning more.

Gree, is a new interpretation of Korean version of Texas Hold'em called 'Seotda', playing with 20 cards from the deck and each players dealt 2 cards(or 3 card variation). Goal is to have the highest scoring hand according to the preset combinations called pedigree.

boardgame.name: Manos a la olla
boardgame.description:
Manos a la olla is a game for 2 to 4 players. Win the final of this magic potion contest before the other witches - cheats and curses welcome!

Each witch will take a magic recipe to prepare. During each turn, each witch plays an action card from her hand to collect new ingredients or take them from the cupboard. You can also use teleport spells to move ingredients (or steal them, ha ha!) between the witches' cauldrons. Finally, you can use a transmute action to magically swap one ingredient for another. As witches are not immune to attacks and traps, the Witch's Reflexes card will save you from more than one trouble!

Witches also get fed up with being cheated, so they can sometimes use spells that will stun their opponents - watch out for them! Among the 20 ingredients, some are very rare. So you'll have to fight for them with other witches to complete your recipe.

Only when your cauldron contains the exact ingredients for your recipe will you be victorious - remember, you must make two to get it! The rules of Hands in the Pot are extremely simple to allow the witch players to interact with each other as much as possible.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rogue Angels: Legacy of the Burning Suns
boardgame.description:
Rogue Angels is a character-driven solo or co-op Sci-Fi adventure for 1-4 players. The game blends engaging narrative with impactful choices leading to multiple paths through various missions and personal journeys.

Rogue Angels merges tactical combat with fluent turns and action management with asymmetric abilities, where you fight behavior-driven enemies through combined card and dice play.

The experience is much more than hack'n'slash, as Rogue Angels takes you through stealth missions, search and rescue, infiltration, evacuations, sabotage and much more. Many missions allow for flexible player approaches and adaptation.

Throughout your journey the decisions you make will permanently shape your character's personality and their relationship with other individuals, opening and closing possible paths along the way.

Rogue Angels offers individual difficulty settings allowing players an experience best suited for their level.

Set in the Burning Suns universe, you will be travelling a diverse galaxy and locations with various factions all vying for their way of life. You get the opportunity to become a hero, shield civilians from conflicts, defend your spaceship from boarding enemies, and help save the galaxy.

But be careful, as your team will be tested in numerous scenarios and face difficult choices in and outside of combat, and you will not be offered a second chance.

As a leader you must be willing to sacrifice everything and your legacy to bring peace to the many species of the Burning Suns.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Undergrowth: A Tunnel Crawling Quest
boardgame.description:
Undergrowth: A Tunnel Crawling Quest is a Euro-inspired American-style strategy game for 2-4 players set underground in an old woodland. Players assemble a gang of local Dwellers with different talents (your gang tableau) and move through ancient tunnels hunting treasures and other rare finds. Treasures can be stashed for victory points or used to boost capabilities (movement, carrying load, health, dueling skill and gang recruitment) and activate tools. Treasure also hires you Dwellers for your gang. As your gang grows your capabilities also grow. As you travel deeper into the tunnel labyrinth, the going gets harder. Blessings from the Green Man God aid your quest, but the murderous Weasels will stop at nothing to prevent you getting your hands on treasure.

Undergrowth is a tableau building game with mixed, interacting mechanics where the aim is to assemble the most skillful, most renowned and wealthiest treasure hunting gang. The winning player has the highest value card tableau and the most stashed gold at the end of 12 rounds. The game combines point to point movement, resource management, tableau building, dice combat and a hint of push your luck to produce a fun, adventurous and interactive tunnel crawling treasure hunt. Players have thinky dilemmas and interesting tactical choices. Deploy your tunnellers, move them through the tunnels, seek and find different treasures, avoid obstacles, interact with opponents, build your gang and grow your wealth and local reputation. Recruit new gang members from the local Inn and pay their cost to add them to your gang, then use their immediate or ongoing skills to become the dominant treasure hunting gang.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Body Witness to the Sword
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Disease and famine has struck Chrysanthemum Valley. Something is killing off both the sweetfish and the mulberry shrubs the valley is known for, threatening the livelihoods of everyone in Crossroads Village. Duke Teru sees witches wherever he looks, and has dispatched several of his knights to find the source of what he insists is a curse. Unbeknownst to him, the Lady Aki has discovered a secret silver mine; the blasting is killing water and soil both, but she plans to be long gone with the silver by the time the Duke discovers her duplicity...

An introductory adventure location for fantasy tabletop adventure games. Suggested for a party of 3-4 level one adventurers.

boardgame.name: Reflecto
boardgame.description:
Reflecto is a word guessing game with mirrors.

Players move their pawns using the movement rule from Checkers.

To win the game, place your letters on the edge of play board to make your secret word. Or use your mirror to figure out opponent's letters and guess the secret word.

boardgame.name: The Lost Tomb
boardgame.description: The Fifth Adventure from the Dungeons & Dragons and NERDS promotion. Includes the Character Sheet for "Purple" as a Wizard.

boardgame.name: A Web of Lies
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Sixth Adventure from the Dungeons & Dragons and NERDS promotion. Includes the Character Sheet for "Yellow" a Cleric.

boardgame.name: Legends Untold: Potions & Preparations Expansion Set
boardgame.description:
Long ago, when the Orakhee fell upon the Brethren Empire, the Gnimshka listened to the earth and it protected them. Today the great Glyptographers of the Gnimhomes teach their disciples how to inscribe the rocks of the world, releasing the Lustre within them in an art they call Petromagika.

From the revered Gardeners of Achea, to the humble village Broth Apothecarys of the Painted Forest, almost every culture on Mor Nadar knows that foraging for plants, and scavenging some of the remains of animals, can yield treasure when combined with the skilled use of pestle and mortar.

Potions and Preparations is an optional expansion for the Legends Untold game system. This set unlocks new options for Heroes to gather resources during their adventures and use them to make alchemical potions and magical preparations.

This set introduces:

New Resource types for Alchemy – 80 new Plant and Animal Reagent cards which can be used to brew exciting Potions.
A new magic system - the ancient art of Petromagika; inscribe the 56 new Mineral Resource cards and used them in Preparations to unleash the magical Lustre within.
45 new Potions and Preparations to make. Will you use the ‘Draft of Foresight’ to Divine the next 3 Adventure cards, or maybe you will place your inscribed gem inside the ‘Steel Shot’ Preparation enchanting your Crossbow bolts with lethal penetration.


A range of new options to help you build the character you want to play, specialising or dabbling as you see fit:

2 new Occupation cards; the Gnimshka Stone Scout and Persi Apothecary
New Kits and Outfits to assist you in gathering and preparing resources
6 Skill Talents to support gathering and using Herbs, Plants, Animal Reagents and Minerals.
2 new weapons; the Gnimshka Gastraphetes crossbow and the Sagaris club/axe
6 Weapon Talents used in conjunction with the two new Weapons provided



New Herb and Gem Loot Items for use with the Adventure and Treasure decks.
Updated Location cards for the caves and sewers sets to help you find the minerals you are looking for.


This set requires a core set to use it.

This expansion pack works in conjunction with the Alchemy Booster Pack (which is intended to be reprinted in the Novice Booster Set Volume II) and there are rules for updating those cards in conjunction with this set.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legends Untold: Illumination of Deepsorrow Novice Set
Legends Untold: The Great Sewers Novice Set
Legends Untold: Weeping Caves Novice Set

boardgame.name: Guess Chess
boardgame.description:
Minimalistic 2-player tactical card game with elements of chess figures.

Players take turns in secretly placing 8 figure cards on a 4x4 board. Last placed figure is instantly revealed and begins a chain of attack = reveal an opponent's card in its reach. The first player who cannot reach any card with their revealed figure, loses.

boardgame.name: Trail Run
boardgame.description:
Trail Run is a push-your-luck game simulating long-distance running races on various terrain. Like in real life running events, players will have to pace themselves by deciding how many times they will roll the dice and thus try to run fast, but not too fast to avoid blowing up before they reach the finish line.

Players will roll the dice to move their pawns across the race course and the goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the Finish line which is the last space located on the Open Road terrain card.

On their turn player rolls 2 neutral dice: if different, player advances 1 step; if equal, 2 steps; if their sum is 7, player goes bust. In this last case the turn ends, otherwise the player may decide to roll again.

Before rolling the dice, player may announce they whish to use a water bottle to avoid going bust on the next roll.
There are 9 terrain cards and majority of them introduce some modifications to the game rules.

boardgame.name: The Grim Harvest and Other Tales: An Into the Wyrd and Wild Compendium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A legend amongst the people, told to children to get them to bed, told to young mothers as a warning to watch over their young. Some believe it is how the children of the woods grow their numbers, others chalk it up to explanations of plague, and some think the moon calls to the young. :lang="en">If it happened with regularity they could try to stop it; but without apparent reason, sometimes night will fall, the parents will sleep, and the children will walk out of the city into the wyrd and wild.

The woods do not care for you. Never forget that.

The book contains:

Three adventures
Two short stories
Design notes from Charles Fergusson-Avery
Concepts art, sketches, doodles and creator commentary for Into the Wyrd and Wild

boardgame.name: Shotguns & Sorcery: The Pathfinder Conversion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

FIND YOUR OWN PATH
EVEN IF YOU HAVE TO CUT IT
STRAIGHT THROUGH THE HEART
OF DRAGON CITY

Sometimes when you play your game, you just want to play it your own way. If you’re a fan of the Pathfinder system, your road into Dragon City just got a lot clearer.

This succinct guide details how to convert Shotguns & Sorcery: The Roleplaying Game to work with the Pathfinder 1st Edition system. It features full statistics for dozens of NPCs, including all of the biggest figures from the Shotguns & Sorcery tales. Plus there are rules for firearms, magic items, and the many monsters that make Dragon City and its environs such a dangerously fun place for any adventuring party to visit—or even to call home.

boardgame.name: Miners & Mobsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

IT'S A DIRTY JOB
BUT SOMEONE'S GOT TO DO IT
EVEN IF IT MEANS CRAWLING
THROUGH DRAGON CITY'S GUTS

When undead trouble comes scratching at the cellar door of everyone’s favorite speakeasy on the edge of Goblintown, the bartender begs the patrons for help rooting it out. They have to move fast before the Imperial Dragon’s Guard gets involved and shuts them down for good. Even if they manage it, though, their problems are just starting. After all, the wall around Dragon City is supposed to keep the zombies out. So who’s letting them in?

This introductory adventure for Shotguns & Sorcery: The Roleplaying Game is the perfect way to launch your campaign. It comes complete with two intruiging, action-packed chapters and suggestions for further fun, plus six pregenerated charcters ready for players to pick up and run. No Shotguns & Sorcery Game Master should brave the city without it.

boardgame.name: Cantrips (That You Didn't Know You Needed)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cantrips that you didn't know you needed! At least two from each school of magic, it's pretty lit, trust me.

boardgame.name: Wild Wild Quest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

GIDDY UP COWPERSONS, IT'S TIME FOR THE RODEO! All you outlaws out there, come on into the saloon and... *pause for spitting in a spitoon* ...have yourself a cup of that fire water. --- You ever heard of the Trailblazer Ranger? You ever heard of the Renegade Rogue? Well, that's what you'll get in here. That and some feats, some backgrounds, and an encounter: THE TALE OF THE NIGHTRIDER.

boardgame.name: Willforged Wonders
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The magic woven into this legendary type of item is potent and carries the will of its originator. Each item awaits attunement, and once attuned, it gives you a taste of its power. As you use this item, it gradually observes your actions, awaiting the moment to make a judgment and determine whether or not you are a fit successor to the last will of the soul bonded within. Willforged Wonders are indestructible unless power equivalent to a wish spell is used to destroy it. Born when the soul of a creature with an indestructible will latches onto an important possession that had significant meaning to it, these items bestow those they judge worthy with great power. Through usage, you and the Willforged Wonder will form a deeper connection, and eventually it may bond with you in an magical covenant, where you awaken a new power within both you and your Willforged Wonder.

boardgame.name: Bear vs Bull
boardgame.description:
Each player will contribute to creating the graph (Candelsticks) of one (or more) quoted Financial Instrument, by playing cards from his hand. In his turn, the player can also decide to open or close positions, betting on the rise or fall of the Financial Instrument. The player will earn from the difference between the price at which he opened the position and the price at which he closes the position.
It is essential to study the intentions of the opponents and hinder them while trying to position themselves strategically. Some Money Management cards help you to better manage your positions and hinder your opponents with the typical dynamics of drawing cards, having them discarded, spying or playing out of your turn.
Attention instead to the Event cards that once drawn are activated and can upset the market (and the wallet of those who have risked too much). Of course, whoever earns the most wins.

The game is designed to have an elementary basic development that mirrors the development on the market of a financial instrument. The player is led to make delicate choices based on market trends, dealing with an emotional state and risk management that are typical of real operations.

In this sense, the game is designed so that statistically the rise in prices is slower than the relative descents (you go up the stairs and go down with the elevator). At the same time it will never be possible to know in a game, if you are in a bear market or a bull market as some random cards are removed from the deck at each game.

The entire game is designed to give food for thought and teaching. The possibility of comparison is in fact a competitive advantage that very often people in the financial world do not use due to the difficulty of dealing with such delicate issues as personal investments.

The possibility of comparison is continuously solicited by combining different financial instruments and players with market situations and risk appetites that are different for each of us.

boardgame.name: Maps for Fantasy RPGs I: Old School
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Laidback DM's Maps for Fantasy RPGs 1 - Old School is a collection of 45 hand-drawn maps and zip file of 90 digital image files, which come with a limited commercial license allowing you, the purchaser, to use them royalty-free in your own commercial or private publication projects.

Dungeons, mansions, temples, towers, cities, ruins, lairs, wilderness and more! All map images are high quality 600DPI (print quality is 300DPI) black and white JPEGS and are unlabeled, so you can add your own labels as needed.

These maps are system-neutral and can be used with any fantasy game.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Champions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pathfinder Second Edition brings a ton of cool classes and options to the table like the champion as a mighty force for goodness in all its forms, but we take that one step further with a whole set of champions of the boundless heavens! Unleash 5 new champion tenets like Hollowed, Luminary, and Argent, each with their own unique reactions like Obscuring Essence and Shining Onslaught. Plus get 8 new champion feats and focus spells like glorious valor and hand of the sky!

boardgame.name: Ear of Stone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this adventure for ENnie-Nominated BEOWULF Age of Heroes, our Hero arrives at the isle of Hreodan, where bonds of family and tradition are in grave peril, and danger lurks just beneath the surface...

Hreodan is an island protected from both storms and reavers by its resident guardian spirit. Those of the Book think the spirit is an angel sent by God, while those of the Old Ways say it is a holmgaast, or sea spirit, haunting the island and surrounding waters. Most residents of the island don’t see why it can’t be both. Whatever the spirit’s true nature, its protection makes Hreodan an ideal location for sailors to resupply and trade, earning the island’s meadhall the nickname of Wayfarer’s Rest.

Or so it was, until Hreodan’s guardian turned against it.

boardgame.name: Monsters of the Multiverse
Mordenkainen Presents Monsters of the Universe
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

There are many frightening things lurking in the pages of Mordenkainen, but FOMO isn't one of them...

boardgame.name: Camel Express!
boardgame.description:
About a thousand years ago, somewhere in the world which is now called the middle east, two siblings started a new business: a delivery company called "Camel Express". But how could they convince people to use their services? And which of the two siblings should lead the company?
They found an answer to both questions: The most successful one will be the "Boss"!

In Camel Express!, two players compete against each other to prove who is the better businessperson and should be the boss. After the third new moon appeared, the player who manages to send the biggest Caravan on its journey is the winner of the game.

You can play this game in 3 different difficulties: Basic, Normal, and Advanced. We recommend starting with the Basic version and after just a few games and getting to know the rules, Play the Normal game. Do the same with the Normal game until you feel you are ready for some more challenges in the Advanced difficulty.

Game Setup (Basic mode)

Lay down the 4 Caravanserai cards in front of the players
Shuffle the New Moon card among the last 5 cards of the deck to form the Traders deck.
Deal 6 cards to each player (from the top of the Traders deck)
Each player gets a Meeple of her/his color.


Game Play
Beginning with the second player, both players must put their meeple on a Caravanserai of their choosing. The game plays in turns. In each turn, the player can do one of these four actions:


Place a card on one of Caravanserai
Place a hidden card in front of himself/herself
Draw cards
Change Caravanserai


End of the Game
During the action of drawing cards, if any player draws the New Moon card, the first round immediately ends. The game plays in 3 rounds. After the first round is over, start the second and then the third round exactly the same as the first round. After the third round is finished, the player with the highest total point is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pop for Word Families
boardgame.description:
How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Pop for Letters
boardgame.description:
How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Pop for Blends
boardgame.description:
How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Adventure Together
boardgame.description:
user summary

The seventh and final Adventure from the D&D and NERDS promotion, Restoring Harmony. Adventure Together is the culmination of the previous 6 Solo Adventures, encouraging a 6 player party to complete.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Plus Religious Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Religion goes hand in hand with politics and adventurers tend to get involved in a bit of both. Whether they are simply overhearing rumors at the local tavern or actively engaging in or practicing a religion, a whole new world of conflict and drama awaits them; once they get a look at the inner workings of the holy churches or the mysterious temples.
Presented here are 100 unique religious events that are focused on realism and narrative-building roleplay. This list will help you bring the theme of religious conflicts into your campaign in a more nuanced and believable way.
This is an essential tool and reference that a GM will be able to use over and over again.
1d100 adventure hooks and flavorful events for memorable roleplaying situations
Inspired by medieval history and real world events
Supernatural / magic references are kept to a bare minimum – gives you full control of the tone of your game
Almost exclusively non-combat content – keep using your favorite random encounter tables
Includes 12 additional support tables for excellent variation and further inspiration
Perfect for slice of life, OSR, historical and medieval fantasy games
System Agnostic – use with your favorite RPGs

boardgame.name: Far Cry: Beyond
boardgame.description: In Far Cry: Beyond, a spinoff series based on Ubisoft's Far Cry universe, you head back to the 1980s for an explosive co-op tabletop adventure.

boardgame.name: Purging of Segedwyn
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The contents of this adventure were generated entirely by the OpenAI playground, a privately sourced tool used for experiments like this one in the field of computationally generated text.

And now, Open AI, Please write a synopsis paragraph of the entire module:

"The adventure has six encounters. The players start the adventure in the village of Wytham. There they meet Tolven, who is a member of the Segedwyn resistance. Tolven tells the players that the king of Segedwyn is a bad man and that Tolven wants them to go to Segedwyn and kill the king. The players are given the Sword of Segedwyn. The Sword of Segedwyn is a magic item that was made by an evil wizard. The wizard used it hundreds of years ago to defeat the king.

The players start their journey to Segedwyn when Tolven tells them to go to the next village over. The players meet the mayor of the next village. The mayor takes them to the manor where they meet the high ranking member of the Slavers Guild. The players try to kill the high ranking member.

The players then go to Segedwyn and meet with the resistance leader, Nafarian. Nafarian tells the players that the king is in the castle. He also tells them that there are three henchmen that help the king. He also tells them that there is a fourth evil king: Matt the Rat King. Nafarian tells the players that they would be welcome in Segedwyn and that they could help take down the king. He tells them that they are welcome because they have the sword."

Explore a story of "fractured societies and forbidden magic", and discover the (quite unbalanced) magical power of the Sword of Segedwyn (or was it a staff?)

This adventure is published AS-IS (which means no human hands or minds have balanced the encounters, the stats, or anything else), run at your own risk!

boardgame.name: Flabbergasted! Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Flabbergasted is a narrative-driven and rules-lite tabletop RPG set in the roaring 20s!

Comedic scenarios and light-hearted adventures are at the heart of Flabbergasted, drawing inspiration from the likes of Jeeves and Wooster, Fawlty Towers and Around the World in 80 Days.

In this game, you will embark on all manner of marvellous misadventures. You will fend off dastardly debtors, concoct cantankerous capers, navigate scandalous soirées, prevent misguided marriages, and partake in a smorgasbord of other alliterative adventures!

You’ll take on the role of either an affable Aristocrat, an entrepreneurial Well-to-do, an idealistic Bohemian, or one of the ever-ready and stalwart Help.

Together, you and your friends will join an up-and-coming social club, encounter secret societies, and work towards leaving your mark in this world. Will you conform to the scrupulous standards of good society, or simply embrace your scandalous reputation and just try to have a bloody good time?

boardgame.name: The Deadly Dive
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Archaeological revelations! Mythical amphibious monsters! Subtle intrigue! Travel through time! When the heroes investigate a set of mysterious underwater ruins in the Caspian Sea, they get more than they bargained for!

boardgame.name: Instant Mafia
boardgame.description:
Instant Mafia is a quick card game where players manage their mafia to earn the most money. Whenever a player's front is discovered and their Boss eliminated, the game ends.

Instand Mafia takes place over two phases: #1. Establishing your Mafia, and #2. Ruling the Streets.

In Phase 1, players bid on characters and actions to add to their crime syndicate, using their starting resources. This is a group bidding time with a limited duration.

In Phase 2, players play repeated timed live rounds until the game ends (a Boss is defeated). Players may purchase more characters and actions to add to their Mafia, earn money from various crimes, or encounter other enemy Mafia members on the community streets. All players must manage their members and act at the same time, giving them orders and sending them around to do various tasks in under 30 seconds. After the time for orders is up, all players fulfill their character's actions and the game continues...unless a Boss has been outed!

Once one Mafia's Boss is defeated, the game ends and the player who has accumulated the most wealth at the end wins!

boardgame.name: Leaving the Nest
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The burdens of the City of Blackmoor were eased by prior-adventurers, or were they? New adventurers answer the call to investigate a rash of terrible crimes on the home front. Getting in deep, they find something very strange lurking under the city.

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 1-3.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Hadeen's Vengeance
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The prophets have promised that one day, Hadeen would return to take his vengeance on those who destroyed him. His loyal followers are now joyous with the new promise that their dead god will soon rise.

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor World Premier Episode and the conclusion of the Epic of Hadeen series.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: As the Seasons Change
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Snow has started to melt as the seasons change. The Dwarves of the Stormkiller Mountains are brewing up something secret and they need your help to keep it that way.

ADave Arneson’s Blackmoor episode for heroes level 1-6.

Recommended for characters with Smusha.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: To Catch a Rat
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Why is it when the Wizard’s Cabal gets careless, you have to get down and dirty?

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for hero levels 1-5.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: The Confectionary King II: The Candyman Cometh
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It’s been a year since the confectioner laid his scepter at their feet. It burned inside Lixx’s mind the way he suffered sweet defeat. In the dark abandoned oven, Calelrin baked a scrumptious plan, to tempt the whole of Blackmoor with his evil Candyman. “Their gluttonous hides,” Calelrin cried, “is what will do them in. This time he won’t be bested, this time he’s sure to win!”

Part of the themed modules: The Businessmen of Blackmoor.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 5 to 13.

WARNING: This adventure contains many adult themes and graphic circumstances; it is recommended for mature audiences.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Wound Behind the Scar
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Every Scar has a story behind it. The Redwood Scar is no different. Can the heroes uncover it before the Scar consumes us all?

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 7-11.

Recommended for heroes who participated in the adventure The Redwood Scar.

This is Part 6 of the Curse of the Westryn series.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: The Coming Storm
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Nestled in the Stormkiller Mountains, the people of Ironholm have caught themselves a most unusual creature, and they have no idea what to do with it. However, wherever little creatures can be found, their parents may not be far behind. Will Ironholm survive when Papa comes looking for his only son?

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 2-8.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: From Below
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Part one of the series, “A Day in the Strife.”

Within the Wizard’s Cabal a new realization has come to manifest that the organization is not as powerful as thought to believe and unable to combat the forces wielded by Wizard King Goss and the Arcane Dominion of Raddai. With their most powerful spells beaten aside easily, a new source of power has been brought to the attention of the Wizard’s Cabal by the mysterious Trophimus of the Directory of Antiquities and that it could turn the tide of battle in favor of the Wizard’s Cabal and their allies.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 4 to 13.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: A World Without Sunshine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Part one of the series, “Blood from the Stone.”

Uberstar Khazakhum has returned to take his place as Regent of the Mines. The old dwarf has returned from the Dwoemer Realm with tales of the Spherule Thearchy and a marvelous treasure that the dwarves of the Iron Hills can use to defeat the Orcs who they have been at war with for some time and he wants you to steal it.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 7 to 13.

This Episode requires the use of Clock and Steam!
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Family Secrets
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Every family has its secrets, but what happens when your family secret is the cause of much heartache to your whole race?

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor Adventure for ATL 3-15.

Recommended for characters that have played Episode 18: Kissing Day, Episode 26: Lessons, and Episode 51: Portents.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Erethor's Tower
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Westryn Elves have found the location of a rift leading into the plane of negative energy. The rift is in the location of an ancient secret. Can the heroes help to uncover the secret before the rift opens to its full potential?

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor Adventure for ATL 3-15.

Recommended for characters who have played Episode 18: Kissing Day, Episode 26: Lessons, and Episode 51: Portents.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Renascence
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

"re·nas·cence (rĭ-năs'əns, -nā'səns) n. 1. A new birth or life; a rebirth. 2. A cultural revival; a renaissance."

Those revived and renewed, now strengthened by their recent actions, move to complete a task planned generations ago; to bring their old ways fully into the present. A voice in the night provides a chance to change the course of their actions. Another voice seeks to ensure their renaissance.

A one round Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for PCs levels 4 to 12.

Third and final episode in the Three R's Trilogy, and part of the Foretold series.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Ascendance
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A close friend is due great honors, but he is missing. His wife begs for help, but something is wrong with her as well. Which is stronger for you, friendship or truth?

Part 5 in the "Holidays for Heroes" series.

Best for characters that have completed one episode in the series or DAB037: Contagion. Otherwise the character must have at least one Nobility point.

Characters using non-detection items will not be contacted, and thus may not participate.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for heroes levels 11 to 13.

Ascendance: A revered and holy time. Ascendance is a three day religious ceremony for most of the North’s religions. High priests are announced, common folk flock to temples, and powerful items of holy might are created. By edicts of the king and temples, no work is performed on these holy days under penalty of imprisonment and a heavy monetary fine. Priests, paladins, and druids observe Ascendance by passing out alms and tending to the starving and sick.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Miau
boardgame.description:
The sun is rising in the village of warrior cats, where everyone has just fallen asleep, exhausted after another festive dawn. Nobody dreams that the times of peace have their minutes numbered. The Mob of Rats begins the silent invasion, descending the sacred mountain thirsting for revenge.

Miau is a game of hand management and set collection for 1 to 4 players with a very little downtime. In a player turn, he/she should take a simple action: either buy a card or defeat a rat. You must defeat a rat using cats of same breed and using a unique power depending on cat used.

At the end of the game, who managed to use cat breeds efficiently and collect more points will be the winner of the village of warrior cats.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: City of the Gods (Low-Level)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Deep in the heart of the harsh landscape of the Valley of the Ancients lies Blackmoor’s greatest mystery, an accursed place the local desert tribes know only as the City of the Gods. One royal expedition to the site has already failed to return, and now you must traverse unforgiving wilds and dangers untold in search of the truth of the missing expedition.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for ATL’s 5 & 7.

User summary:

See also City of the Gods
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: City of the Gods (Mid-Level)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Deep in the heart of the harsh landscape of the Valley of the Ancients lies Blackmoor’s greatest mystery, an accursed place the local desert tribes know only as the City of the Gods. One royal expedition to the site has already failed to return, and now you must traverse unforgiving wilds and dangers untold in search of the truth of the missing expedition.

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for ATL’s 9 & 11.

User summary:

See also City of the Gods
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Agents of War
boardgame.description: In Agents of War, players are rival governments seeking influence over modern battlefields. Use whatever resources are at your disposal, whether its drones, blackmail, or an allied dictator. Agents of War doesn’t determine who’s right, only who’s left.

boardgame.name: Rolling Thunder
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Regent of the Mines has been fighting a losing war against the Orcs of the Dwoemer Realm. A recent foray into the depths has returned a fantastic engine core to power the Dwarves most impressive war machine yet. This giant tunneling vehicle, armed with the Wizards’ Cabal weaponry and hardened plates of ferrous adamantine is destined to take the fight to the Orcs in the dark recesses of the world where the green skins live and breed. This giant harbinger of death can cause the very ground to shake and the rock to tremble. Gnome engineers have named this invincible weapon Rolling Thunder. Unfortunately, last night, someone stole it...

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor one round adventure for players levels 7-13.

Part two of the series, “Blood from the Stone.”

WARNING: This adventure takes place in the Dwoemer Realm and is recommended for well balanced parties and players who have previously participated in Episode 84: From Below and Episode 85: A World Without Sunshine.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: The End
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hear the tale of the land called Blackmoor, a place full of death, suffering; its demise is one for the history books, a fight for survival against creatures from the deep.

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor Interactive event for players levels 9-15.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: The Beginning
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There’s trouble in the North this night, a feeling of unknown, we’re stuck here in the future and our destiny’s unknown. We knew the timeline was corrupted, but we didn’t believe until Mithgilivyr told us and our friends all disappeared. So friends, here’s our chance now, to foil evil’s plan; here’s a couple items we’ll strike just the way we planned. They’re sorry it went down like this, but sacrifice ain’t new; it’s the nature of the business, it’s what adventurers do.

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor one round adventure for players levels 9-15.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Season 4

boardgame.name: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor 4e MMRPG: Guide to Meta Organizations
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Presents information regarding character builds and options for metagaming organizations involved with the campaign.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Exodus - The Year of Prophecy

boardgame.name: In Brightest Day, In Blackest Night
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In 1299, a new age is dawning, diplomacy happens and you are part of it. Or at least delivering it for those in leadership positions of the great city states that are part of it. But nothing is ever as simple as it seems, with danger and treachery lurking everywhere, even In Brightest day, In Blackest Night...

A Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor adventure for heroic level characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Exodus - The Year of Prophecy

boardgame.name: No Evil Shall Escape My Sight
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In 1299 a new age is dawning and the Peshwah Nation is in need of aid. Unsure of who to blame for their horses disappearing from the Plains of Hak, they are seeking the help of outsiders. Can you discover the thieves, return the horses of the Peshwah and identify the culprits?

A Dave Arneson's Blackmoor adventure for heroic level characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Exodus - The Year of Prophecy

boardgame.name: Escape From A Dying Planet
boardgame.description:
Who knew that landing on a potentially unstable yet exponentially profitable planet would’ve had consequences? Lo and behold, the predictable has happened and the planet has started to collapse. But fear not! The Planetary Development Corporation (PDC) has sent along a life pod with your expedition in case something bad happened. However, they’re not going to just let any old survivor of a cataclysmic event in! You have to prove your value to the PDC, and you do that by bringing back the rarest and most priceless artifacts from your expedition. If you can, it looks like a life of leisure and riches await. If you can’t, then you don’t have to worry about it for very long…

Welcome to Escape from a Dying Planet, a push your luck style card game where you and the other members of your doomed expedition fight to make it to the escape pod, grabbing as much treasure along the way and get off the planet! This game is a 2-8 player card game where players must try to overcome challenges and bid on treasures over the course of 10 turns. Be careful as you can gain contamination which will clog your deck and gain you negative points. Whomever has the highest value of treasures at the end wins!

boardgame.name: Blackmoor D&D 4th Edition: The Inventor Class
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rather than tap into the arcane forces of magic, or submit yourself to the hierarchy of the divine, you've chosen a different approach to study and power. You work in clockwork and steam, in gears and springs, in alchemical reagents and conductive coils. You are an engineer and scientist, and in your devices reside power equal to any sword or spell.
boardgame.rpgseries: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor: The MMRPG Exodus - The Year of Prophecy

boardgame.name: Oz Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Limoneags, and Kalidahs, and Orks, Oh My!

This massive monster supplement details over 300 weird and wondrous creatures drawn from all the Oz literature in the public domain by L. Frank Baum, Ruth Plumly Thompson, and Jack Snow.

This Faerie setting encompasses much more than Oz, from the skylands of Un to the underground world of the nomes, from the Land of Ev to Merryland, Ix, and the Valley of Mo.

These monsters are divided by ecosystem: the Isles, the Overworld, the Sky, and the Underworld. Also included are rules for closed domains and random encounters in each ecosystem. Challenge ratings range from 0 (Crawling Bird) to 23 (Choggenmugger).

So put on your silver shoes and step out onto the yellow brick road. Your Oz adventure awaits!

boardgame.name: Demon Driven to the Maw
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SOMETHING IS WEIRD ABOUT THIS PARTY IN 16TH CENTURY SCOTLAND.

A famous thief stole a magical jewel and hid inside a castle where a party is taking place. Enter the party, find the jewel, escape with your life.

A spooky 16 page party-crawl adventure for tabletop role-playing games
Written for Cairn RPG by Yochai Gal (It's free!)
Compatible with Into the Odd, Electric Bastionland, and loosely compatible with other new-school old-school RPGs
(A perfect one-shot (play test time: approx. 3 hours)
Includes high resolution map files for VTT use

boardgame.name: DC Comics Jumpchain CYOA
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The DC universe is long and storied one, in more ways than one. It’s a universe filled with adventure around every corner, not least among them on Earth, an unassuming but cosmically significant planet out of the way of most space territories. Heroes and villains, from the bottom of the Dark Multiverse to the top of the Monitor Sphere, endlessly struggle for justice, for power, and for control over the fate of the very multiverse itself.

boardgame.name: I Got Caught Up in a Hero Summon, but the Other World was at Peace!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[???]: Well, well, what do we have here? ‘Jumper’ was it? Your Benefactor told us to take care of the introductions this time over. Nice to meet ya~~

[!!!]: Why are you so relaxed?! The fact that there’s someone even more outrageous than Shallow Vernal is already shocking enough! I can’t even imagine how some people would react if they knew this…

[???]: Well, nothing we can do about it anyway. So, Jumper, first of all this mysterious transcendental beauty here and the waste of space over there are called
[???] and
[!!!]. We may look like the Phantasmal King and the God of Disasters or certain afterword due, but there’s no actual relation between us. We were kinda made to be your guides…

[!!!]: Rather than giving some weird introductions, shouldn’t we be explaining about the world and circumstances? – Jumper, listen well. This world is called Trinia and it’s divided into three realms, one for the Gods, one for the Humans, and one for the Demons. It was created by Shallow Vernal-sama thousands of years ago-

[???]: I was just about to talk about that, you idiot! Indeed, much like there are three realms, the beings in this world can be roughly categorized in those same three divisions. Although, strictly speaking, there are many, many races, species, and types of beings in these lands

[!!!]: Each realm has their own leaders. The Human countries have their Kings and Emperors depending on each country. The Demon Realm is likewise controlled by the Six Kings who are the strongest demons around. While the God Realm is led by the Three Supreme Gods and the being that stands above all, Shallow Vernal.

[???]: Shallow Vernal doesn’t do much actual leading though. You can also see their strong cultural differences in each realm, with Human changing titles, passing down them to blood relatives and such. The Demons meanwhile value strength and the Gods are real fans of sticking to the hierarchy and positions.

[!!!]: For a long time, these realms didn’t interact with each other. While 20000 years ago the Demons led by Kuromueina did invade the God Realm for personal reasons, as a whole they kept to each other. The Human realm, after being created, was also unaware of the Demon Realm at large.

[???]: That changed nearly a thousand years ago because of some weakling that mistook the feelings of her adoptive mother. Taking the underserved name of ‘Demon Lord’, the dumb kid ended up invading the Human Realm. Well, even if she wasn’t that strong by Demon standards, she was still overwhelmingly powerful when compared to humans.

[!!!]: At the time the humans used the ‘summoning circle’ magic to summon an individual from another world. That girl, Hikari, would end up becoming the Hero that, alongside her friends, defeated the Demon Lord and her army, and
then spent years establishing peace between the humans, as well as with the other Realms… Umu. That was a serious development I can approve of!

[???]: The actual journey and Hero were a lot sillier than you may think by just hearing that.

[!!!]: Still, in her name and deeds, the Human Realm created a tradition in which they would summon another person from the same world as the first hero to aid them in the festival every ten years. It’s a big event to remember why the Three Realms are friends

[???]: The world is really at peace to bother with such things… Not like the first hero was the only one pushing for peace at the time, and many have worked tirelessly to keep the balance you see nowadays.

[!!!]: Regardless, it's a great responsibility to take care of it. This time over, in a few days, the summoning ceremony is to be conducted by Lilia Albert from the Kingdom of Symphonia…

[???]: If things go on as they are right now, then there will be certain problems with it. Namely, the fact that there will be some extras summoned alongside the teen that plays the role of hero.

[!!!]: For some reason, you got some say on choosing how things will play out. We will be keep explaining you things as we go on

[???] Yeah, yeah. Also have this already, Jumper. We don’t have all day.

boardgame.name: The Great Ruler Part 1 - Academic Accolades
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Great Thousand Worlds. Contrary to its name, this is a singular massive world, though it overlooks countless Lower Planes. Countless different clans, sects, and races live throughout this vast land. If you have visited the worlds of Battle Through The Heavens or Wu Dong Qian Kun, you may recognise this world as the place that the respective 'main characters' of those worlds ascended to when they reached the peak of their Lower Planes. Indeed it has been several hundred years since they did so, each establishing themselves as a peak faction in the Great Thousand Worlds. However this is not their tale.

boardgame.name: Sinoda
boardgame.description:
Sinoda is an abstract strategy game played using 4-sided dice as the pieces on a beautiful "flower of life" pattern board. Players must capture the most points worth of pieces from their opponents.

On their turn, a player may either move a piece exactly the number shown on the top at the piece, or they may rotate a piece to increase or decrease the top number by 1. The number at the top is the piece's movement value, indicating how many spaces it must move (should you choose to move it), but it is also the points value of the piece, awarded to the opposing player if they capture it. Captures are made by finishing a move on top of another player's piece. During a move, a piece may not move over another piece, or backtrack through a space it just went through.

In a 2-player game, the game ends when one player has lost all of their pieces, or when both players have only a single piece left on the board.
In a 3+ player game, the game ends when one player has captured 6 opposing pieces.

Once the game ends, players add up their captured points. Since the winner is the player with the most captured points, and not the player who has captured the most pieces, it is possible to lose all of your pieces and still win!

boardgame.name: Viktory: Bazaar
boardgame.description:
You are an Arab merchant in the Middle Ages buying rolls of silk cloth in order to complete traditional projects. Completed project cards provide VIKTORY points, and the player with the most points wins the game!

The game takes a maximum of 20 minutes to play and ends after 20 rounds. There are no turns. Everyone plays simultaneously. New rounds are beeped by a timer and players draw up to three new cards and attempt to complete projects. For newer players or larger groups, rounds should be set to 1 minute. With experienced or fewer players, rounds should be set for less time, for example, 35 seconds.

Project cards requiring more resources and rarer resources are harder to complete, but provide significantly more VIKTORY points. Once each round, a player may discard his current project card and draw a new one.

If a player has the right combination of resource cards to complete a project card, he would:
1. Collect the needed resource cards and the project card
2. Turn them facedown in a completed project stack off to the side for end game scoring
3. Draw another project card from the shared deck of project cards

There are no trade restrictions. Players can trade any combination of resource, debt, or project cards as part of a trade.

boardgame.name: Castlevania Anniversary Collection
boardgame.description:
Konami's Castlevania Anniversary Collection traces the origins of the historic vampire franchise. Included is a unique eBook with details provided by developers, artists and others inspired by the Castlevania legacy which sheds a fresh light into the world of Castlevania.

Released as part of the Konami 50th Anniversary celebration, relive these timeless classics that helped define the platformer genre. From the Belmont clan to their extended bloodlines and allies, the Castlevania Anniversary Collection is the best first step for anyone to take into the world of Castlevania and the fight against Dracula!

From https://www.nintendo.com/games/detail/castlevania-anniversar...

boardgame.name: Clear the Decks!: Pirate Hunters
boardgame.description:
Pirates are the scourge of the seas and islands of the world – attacking, robbing, pillaging and kidnapping those that would live and trade in peace. Someone must rise to the fore and rid the waters of these dastardly villains. Take command of a man-o-war, add a brave crew and set out to sea as a Pirate Hunter.

Clear the Decks! Pirate Hunters is an expansion to the original game Clear the Decks! The base game is required to use this expansion. Pirate Hunters adds three new mechanisms and 50 new cards to the original game. The 74 card sized box also has new tokens for adding Marines to the Longboat Attack.

listing.notes:
Includes Clear the Decks! game, Pirate Hunters expansion and set of 2 playmats.
USPS Regional Rate shipping available! Buyer must have Feedback rating greater than 0.
(If you'd like a shipping quote, please include your full mailing address)

boardgame.name: Thunder Road: Vendetta – Choppe Shoppe
boardgame.description:
Some races are bigger than others. In the biggest race of all, you need a veteran leader and some extra gear to come out on top.

This expansion adds crew leaders and car upgrades. Crew leaders provide custom command boards and variable player powers. Car upgrades add special effects to each of your cars.

boardgame.name: Thunder Road: Vendetta – Big Rig and the Final Five
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds two new racing crews to the base game. The Big Rig is a relentless metal beast, bristling with lethal weapons and advanced defense systems. The Final Five are a nimble gang of motorcycles that can zip through the chaos without getting slammed.

The crews can be played in any game with each other or the cars from the base game and also allow for a fifth player.

boardgame.name: Thunder Road: Vendetta – Carnage at Devil's Run
boardgame.description:
Legend tells of a place called Devil’s Run, a land of fire with roads turned to slick glass from the burning sands. The few that emerge tell stories none believe.

This expansion adds new road boards for the base game, featuring dangerous new terrain, ongoing damage and new damage effects, and FIRE!

boardgame.name: The Pirate Republic: Africa Gambit
boardgame.description:
Return to 1713, the dawn of the Golden Age of Piracy. After a decade of war, a rare peace comes to the Spanish Main. With thousands of demobilized sailors, pirating explodes in the West Indies and across the Atlantic.

One crew of pirates, calling themselves the Flying Gang, seek fame, fortune, and self-governance by building their own Republic free from the constraints of kings, queens, and imperialism. Will you work together to build the Pirate Republic? Or will you betray your brethren in pursuit of greater riches? The sea is your territory; anyone on or near it, your prey.

The Pirate Republic: Africa Gambit is a second edition to the original The Pirate Republic. It is a thematic deck building, sandbox adventure game for 1-5 players which also adds West Africa riches, new Pirates, the Portuguese, and a campaign mode into the mix. Set in the early 18th-century, each player is an infamous pirate captain weaving their own tale by performing daring feats and plundering on the high seas.

It's a time of conquest and the lure of riches, indomitable spirit and fat treasure galleons, pirate utopias and watery graves!

Are you ready to get your Pirate on?

How does it play?

You start with a deck of 12 cards, 2 of which are unique to your Pirate while 10 are shared. As you acquire cards and build your deck, your decisions will shape your Pirates’ personality. Your actions determine if you are a cooperative member of the Flying Gang, or a solo Pirate gone rogue, seeking fame and fortune on your own.

Using your cards you will sail across the map, strike fear on enemies, recruit crew, attack, defend, form a pirate haven, sack forts, complete global missions, or build infamy (which lets you gain even stronger cards). Each turn you will draw a hand of cards and take actions with them. Once you are out of cards, play goes to the next Pirate, and this continues until everyone has exhausted their decks.

Individually you are amassing Swagger as quickly as you can while collectively completing the global missions. The game ends when three of four global missions (chosen by the players before the game begins) are completed. If the Flying Gang completes the majority of these missions, they win! Otherwise, whichever Rogue completed the most missions wins. Alternatively, whoever reaches 100 Swagger first is the winner.

.....

boardgame.name: Spartans & Successors
boardgame.description:
Spartans & Successors is a simple set of wargame rules for the Golden Age of Greek and Macedonian history, enabling the great battles of antiquity to be played with limited numbers of figures in a small playing area.

Using a standard deck of playing cards per player and a gridded playing surface the rules offer a unique game play experience.
With elements of resource management and planning, bluff and the application of historical tactics players can refight the great battles of antiquity with limited figures - armies are the same size as a DBA army - on the kitchen table with minimal set up.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC
History: Wars of Alexander the Great
History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

boardgame.name: AirWar 1940: WW2 air combat rules (1939-1945)
boardgame.description:
AirWar 1940 is the latest in our series of fun, fast play air warfare rules that cover the spirit of air combat whilst being a set that would be good for a newcomer to aerial wargaming, or for a more experienced “old hand” who wants a simple yet enjoyable set of rules to introduce new players.

After a couple of games reference to the rule book will become occasional with players concentrating on shooting down their opponents rather than ploughing through the sub-minutiae of clauses and appendices. The requirement for our rules is to provide a game that met the “5 minute rule” for explanation and the “45 minute rule” for game play.

The 41 page rulebook includes rules for aircraft characteristics, movement, special manoeuvres, dog fighting, ground attack, AA fire and even “auto-pilot” bomber formations so you can concentrate on the more fun aspect of shooting them down!
There are also ratings for 254 aircraft era aircraft from thirteen nations, from the last bi-planes of the 1930’s though to the first jets of the late 1940's and early ’50's.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Faux-culte !
boardgame.description:
Faux-culte ! is a new card game to play while having a drink. It contains 220 completely improbable audience (1 star) reviews of films so cult that you know them, even without having seen them! But the whole game is there, will you recognize them ?!

Each player takes turns drawing a card and declaiming the comment aloud and with tone, as if it were their own. The first player to guess the title of the film targeted by the criticism wins the round.
Each player can give as many answers as they want, including while reading the commentary. If the title of the film is guessed before the end of the commentary, do not hesitate to reread the commentary completely so that everyone can enjoy it!

The player who guessed the title of the movie wins the card, which he keeps face down in front of him as a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Does It Matter
boardgame.description:
Does It Matter? is a dark-humored party game that takes place in the outer reaches of space. Players must race through 42 spaces to reach the black hole at the center of the galaxy using their wits, creativity, and strategy.

There are three decks of cards players must draw from in order to move along the board. These decks are:
- DIM: A variety of dark, absurd, and twisted trivia.
- SAD: Player must Sound, Act, Draw, or a combination of these.
- LEMON: Space-themed action cards that move players forward or backward on the board. They can be used on any player and have the potential to become lemon-scented sabotage.

The game ends as soon as a player reaches the black hole and shouts, "Does It Matter" as their piece lands on the final space. If another player says "Does It Matter" first, the win is rejected and the player must move back to their original position.

boardgame.name: Buscadores de Dino
Buscadores de Unicornios
boardgame.description:
Dinosaur fans: Attention! In this game, a group of adventurous friends go out in search of dinos. Armed with fantasy and much joy, they immerse themselves in a world of colors.

Both dice are rolled and all players must look for the card that meets the conditions shown on the dice. Whoever finds the correct card first keeps it. Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Adivina Adivinador
boardgame.description:
How to explain what a PARAGLIDER is? How to imitate the sound of a TRUMPET? How to mimic an Indian? With this game you will be able to explore your expressive capacity 100%

Players must draw cards where a picture is shown and get their partners to guess it. To do this, he must make sounds, mimic or explain what he sees, as indicated on the card taken out. Also, bring 10 action cards to give it more difficulty. The team that manages to guess the most cards is the winner.

boardgame.name: The Middle Path
boardgame.description:
The Middle Path is a board game about everyday Muslim problems. This hilarious, Party-style game, can be played by 2 to 4 players. Play up to 8 players by adding another deck of cards (which can be purchased separately).

Each player will take turns drawing cards from the deck. There are Attack cards, which move you away from the Middle Path, unless you have the correct defend card. Kind Deed cards will take you to the center of the board, unless and opponent ‘steals’ or ‘obstructs’ your kind deeds.

Although a fun party game, there is some strategy to it. Each card in the game simulates real-life problems that Muslims face on a daily basis.

There are 2 ways to win: First to reach the middle path or Last-Muslim-standing.

1 Deck = up to 4 players
2 Decks = up to 8 players
3 Decks = Sectarian violence

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine (Volume 10 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Content:

What If: Starting, And Ending, Scenes
Tool Box: Control Your Adventure With Keyed Scenes
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Control Your Adventure With Keyed Scenes

boardgame.name: Cat & Mouse
boardgame.description:
Two player game where a battery operated wheel of cheese has two colors of mice pop up in the air in a particular sequence.

Each player gets a plastic cat holding a garbage bin that opens with a trigger. The goal is to catch the most mice of either color, or the most of a particular color in the air to win.

boardgame.name: Architects of the West Kingdom: GolonkoCrafts Premium Resources
boardgame.description:
A set of tokens for Architects of the West Kingdom board game.
Consisting of real stone cubes, marble tiles, ceramic bricks and gold bars made from machined brass.
With an optional metal coins add-on

boardgame.name: Dune: Imperium – GolonkoCrafts Premium Resources
boardgame.description:
A set of upgraded resources, consisting of water, spice and solari tokens.
Depending on version water can be either 3D printed droplets or tiny flasks with actual water inside.
Spice can be either small glass crystals or tiny bottles with brown glass sand inside.
Coins are 3D printed in translucent black with glittering specks inside.

Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Héros Targaryen II
boardgame.description: Bloodriders are the most loyal of the Dothraki and this box provides you with the most loyal of those guards, whether for Khal Drogo or the Queen of Dragons.

boardgame.name: Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon – FancyButFunctional Core Insert
boardgame.description: Box Organizer for Tainted Grail base game. It is able to hold all card (that comes with the base game), sleeved into the Awaken Guard premium sleeves. The miniature holder boxes may be ordered with self-adhesive, 2mm thick, laser-cut padding, that is soft enough to keep your miniatures safe, even if those are painted and/or based (many box organizers are unable to store painted miniatures safely). It is actually safer storage for painted miniatures than the original plastic insert, that comes with the game. The organizer is designed so, that the player boards, journal, save sheets and paper pieces are fitting in the box on top of the insert, and the lid of the box is still fitting perfectly.

boardgame.name: Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon – FancyButFunctional Expansion Insert
boardgame.description:
Box Organizer for Tainted Grail wave 2 content. It is able to hold all card, sleeved into the Awaken Guard premium sleeves. Additionally it is able to accommodate the Echoes of the Past and the Red Death expansions, similarly into Awaken Guard sleeves.

The miniature holder boxes may be ordered with self-adhesive, 2mm thick, laser-cut padding, that is soft enough to keep your miniatures safe, even if those are painted and/or based (many box organizers are unable to store painted miniatures safely). It is actually safer storage for painted miniatures than the original plastic insert, that comes with the game.

Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon
Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon – Echoes of the Past
Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon – Red Death Expansion

boardgame.name: Pazzaparola
boardgame.description:
This game is really simple to play, even for players who don’t love word games at all. It's super easy to compose a word related to the theme: you can use all the letters you want, not only the ones in your hand, and creativity and puns are welcome! No frustration in sight!
Of course, you must try to find a word that grants you a higher score than your opponents’!

At the start of the game the Theme is revealed and you receive 8 Letter Cards:

1 - Choose the Letter you like and pass the others to the player at your left
2 - Repeat point 1 until there are no more cards to pass. Receive from the right, pick one, pass to the left. Easy, right?
3 - Compose a word related to the Theme, using as many of your Letters as you can!


The player who finds the word with the highest value wins the current round and scores 1 point. When a player scores the third point, the game ends and that player wins the game. If 2 or more player find a word with the same value, they all score 1 point. If 2 or more players reach the third point in the same round, they share the victory (this happens rarely).

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: UnMetal
boardgame.description:
http://www.unepicfran.com/en/unmetal.html

In 1972 a crack commando squad threw you in prison for a crime you didn't commit. You promptly escaped from a maxumum-security stockade to the underground trying to survive from these soldiers of fortune.

UnMetal is a 2D stealth/action game (with a bit of humor) where the goal is to escape from an enemy military base. But what started as a simple break out ended up being an inside operation to prevent a massive attack against the NATO.
